Date.IsLeapYear_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Determine if the year 2012, as represented by #date(2012, 01, 01) is a leap year.

Date.Month_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the month component of the provided datetime value, dateTime.

Date.MonthName_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the name of the month component.

Date.MonthName_Documentation.LongDescrip.message: Returns the name of the month component for the provided date. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US").

Date.QuarterOfYear_Documentation.Descrip.message: Returns a number indicating which quarter of the year the date falls in.

Date.QuarterOfYear_Documentation.LongDes.message: Returns a number from 1 to 4 indicating which quarter of the year the date dateTime falls in. dateTime can be a date, datetime, or datetimezone value.

Date.QuarterOfYear_Documentation.Example.message: Find which quarter of the year the date #date(2011, 12, 31) falls in.

Date.StartOfDay_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns the start of the day.

Date.StartOfDay_Documentation.LongDescri.message: Returns the start of the day represented by dateTime. dateTime must be a date, datetime, or datetimezone value.

Date.StartOfDay_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Find the start of the day for October 10th, 2011, 8:00AM.

Date.StartOfMonth_Documentation.Descript.message: Returns the start of the month.

Date.StartOfMonth_Documentation.LongDesc.message: Returns the start of the month that contains dateTime. dateTime must be a date or datetime value.

Date.StartOfMonth_Documentation.Examples.message: Find the start of the month for October 10th, 2011, 8:10:32AM.

Date.StartOfQuarter_Documentation.Descri.message: Returns the start of the quarter.

Date.StartOfQuarter_Documentation.LongDe.message: Returns the start of the quarter that contains dateTime. dateTime must be a date, datetime, or datetimezone value.

Date.StartOfQuarter_Documentation.Exampl.message: Find the start of the quarter for October 10th, 2011, 8:00AM.

Date.StartOfWeek_Documentation.Descripti.message: Returns the start of the week.

Date.StartOfWeek_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Returns the start of the week that contains dateTime. dateTime must be a date, datetime, or datetimezone value.

Date.StartOfWeek_Documentation.Examples_.message: Find the start of the week for Tuesday, October 11th, 2011.
Find the start of the week for Tuesday, October 11th, 2011, using Monday as the start of the week.

Date.StartOfYear_Documentation.Descripti.message: Returns the start of the year.

Date.StartOfYear_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Returns the start of the year that contains dateTime. dateTime must be a date, datetime, or datetimezone value.

Date.StartOfYear_Documentation.Examples_.message: Find the start of the year for October 10th, 2011, 8:10:32AM.

Date.ToRecord_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a record containing parts of the date value.

Date.ToRecord_Documentation.LongDescript.message:
Returns a record containing the parts of the given date value, date.
  • date: A date value for from which the record of its parts is to be calculated.

Date.ToRecord_Documentation.Examples_0_D.message: Convert the #date(2011, 12, 31) value into a record containing parts from the date value.

Date.ToText_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a textual representation of the date value.

Date.ToText_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message:
Returns a textual representation of date. An optional record parameter, options, may be provided to specify additional properties. culture is only used for legacy workflows. The record can contain the following fields:
  • Format: A text value indicating the format to use. For more details, go to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180104 and https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180105. Omitting this field or providing null will result in formatting the date using the default defined by Culture.
  • Culture: When Format is not null, Culture controls some format specifiers. For example, in "en-US" "MMM" is "Jan", "Feb", "Mar", ..., while in "ru-RU" "MMM" is "", "", "", .... When Format is null, Culture controls the default format to use. When Culture is null or omitted, Culture.Current is used.
To support legacy workflows, options and culture may also be text values. This has the same behavior as if options = [Format = options, Culture = culture].

Date.ToText_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Convert #date(2010, 12, 31) into a text value. Result output may vary depending on current culture.

Date.ToText_Documentation.Examples_1_Des.message: Convert using a custom format and the German culture.

Date.ToText_Documentation.Examples_2_Des.message: Find the year in the Hijri calendar that corresponds to January 1st, 2000 in the Gregorian calendar.

Date.WeekOfMonth_Documentation.Descripti.message: Returns a number from 1 to 6 indicating which week of the month this date falls in.

Date.WeekOfMonth_Documentation.LongDescr.message:
Returns a number from 1 to 6 indicating which week of the month the date dateTime falls in.
  • dateTime: A datetime value for which the week-of-the-month is determined.

Date.WeekOfMonth_Documentation.Examples_.message: Determine which week of March the 15th falls on in 2011.

Date.WeekOfYear_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns a number from 1 to 54 indicating which week of the year this date falls in.

Date.WeekOfYear_Documentation.LongDescri.message:
Returns a number from 1 to 54 indicating which week of the year the date, dateTime, falls in.
  • dateTime: A datetime value for which the week-of-the-year is determined.
  • firstDayOfWeek: An optional Day.Type value that indicates which day is considered the start of a new week (for example, Day.Sunday). If unspecified, a culture-dependent default is used.

Date.WeekOfYear_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Determine which week of the year contains March 27th, 2011.

Date.WeekOfYear_Documentation.Examples_1.message: Determine which week of the year contains March 27th, 2011, using Monday as the start of the week.

Date.Year_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the year component of the provided datetime value, dateTime.

DateTime.Date_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the date component of the given date, datetime, or datetimezone value.

DateTime.Date_Documentation.LongDescript.message: Returns the date component of dateTime, the given date, datetime, or datetimezone value.

DateTime.From_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a datetime from the given value.

DateTime.From_Documentation.LongDescript.message:
Returns a datetime value from the given value. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US"). If the given value is null, DateTime.From returns null. If the given value is datetime, value is returned. Values of the following types can be converted to a datetime value:
  • text: A datetime value from textual representation. Refer to DateTime.FromText for details.
  • date: A datetime with value as the date component and 12:00:00 AM as the time component.
  • datetimezone: The local datetime equivalent of value.
  • time: A datetime with the date equivalent of the OLE Automation Date of 0 as the date component and value as the time component.
  • number: A datetime equivalent of the OLE Automation Date expressed by value.
If value is of any other type, an error is returned.

DateTime.FromFileTime_Documentation.Desc.message: Creates a datetime from a 64 bits long number.

DateTime.FromFileTime_Documentation.Long.message: Creates a datetime value from the fileTime value and converts it to the local time zone. The filetime is a Windows file time value that represents the number of 100-nanosecond intervals that have elapsed since 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

DateTime.FromText_Documentation.Descript.message: Creates a datetimezone from local and universal datetime formats.

DateTime.FromText_Documentation.LongDesc.message:
Creates a datetime value from a textual representation, text. An optional record parameter, options, may be provided to specify additional properties. The record can contain the following fields:
  • Format: A text value indicating the format to use. For more details, go to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180104 and https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180105. Omitting this field or providing null will result in parsing the date using a best effort.
  • Culture: When Format is not null, Culture controls some format specifiers. For example, in "en-US" "MMM" is "Jan", "Feb", "Mar", ..., while in "ru-RU" "MMM" is "", "", "", .... When Format is null, Culture controls the default format to use. When Culture is null or omitted, Culture.Current is used.
To support legacy workflows, options may also be a text value. This has the same behavior as if options = [Format = null, Culture = options].

DateTime.FromText_Documentation.Examples.message: DateTime.FromText("30 Dez 2010 02:04:50.369730", [Format="dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss.ffffff", Culture="de-DE"])

DateTime.IsInCurrentHour_Documentation.D.message: Indicates whether this datetime occurs during the current hour, as determined by the current date and time on the system.

DateTime.IsInCurrentHour_Documentation.L.message:
Indicates whether the given datetime value dateTime occurs during the current hour, as determined by the current date and time on the system.
  • dateTime: A datetime, or datetimezone value to be evaluated.

DateTime.IsInCurrentHour_Documentation.E.message: Determine if the current system time is in the current hour.

DateTime.IsInCurrentMinute_Documentation.message: Indicates whether this datetime occurs during the current minute, as determined by the current date and time on the system.

Indicates whether the given datetime value dateTime occurs during the current minute, as determined by the current date and time on the system.
  • dateTime: A datetime, or datetimezone value to be evaluated.
Determine if the current system time is in the current minute.

DateTime.IsInCurrentSecond_Documentation.message: Indicates whether this datetime occurs during the current second, as determined by the current date and time on the system.

Indicates whether the given datetime value dateTime occurs during the current second, as determined by the current date and time on the system.
  • dateTime: A datetime, or datetimezone value to be evaluated.
Determine if the current system time is in the current second.

DateTime.IsInNextHour_Documentation.Desc.message: Indicates whether this datetime occurs during the next hour, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current hour.

DateTime.IsInNextHour_Documentation.Long.message:
Indicates whether the given datetime value dateTime occurs during the next hour, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current hour.
  • dateTime: A datetime, or datetimezone value to be evaluated.

DateTime.IsInNextHour_Documentation.Exam.message: Determine if the hour after the current system time is in the next hour.

DateTime.IsInNextMinute_Documentation.De.message: Indicates whether this datetime occurs during the next minute, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current minute.

DateTime.IsInNextMinute_Documentation.Lo.message:
Indicates whether the given datetime value dateTime occurs during the next minute, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current minute.
  • dateTime: A datetime, or datetimezone value to be evaluated.

DateTime.IsInNextMinute_Documentation.Ex.message: Determine if the minute after the current system time is in the next minute.

DateTime.IsInNextSecond_Documentation.De.message: Indicates whether this datetime occurs during the next second, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current second.

DateTime.IsInNextSecond_Documentation.Lo.message:
Indicates whether the given datetime value dateTime occurs during the next second, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current second.
  • dateTime: A datetime, or datetimezone value to be evaluated.

DateTime.IsInNextSecond_Documentation.Ex.message: Determine if the second after the current system time is in the next second.

DateTime.IsInPreviousHour_Documentation..message: Indicates whether this datetime occurs during the previous hour, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current hour.

Indicates whether the given datetime value dateTime occurs during the previous hour, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current hour.
  • dateTime: A datetime, or datetimezone value to be evaluated.
Determine if the hour before the current system time is in the previous hour.

DateTime.IsInPreviousMinute_Documentatio.message: Indicates whether this datetime occurs during the previous minute, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current minute.

Indicates whether the given datetime value dateTime occurs during the previous minute, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current minute.
  • dateTime: A datetime, or datetimezone value to be evaluated.
Determine if the minute before the current system time is in the previous minute.

DateTime.IsInPreviousSecond_Documentatio.message: Indicates whether this datetime occurs during the previous second, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current second.

Indicates whether the given datetime value dateTime occurs during the previous second, as determined by the current date and time on the system. Note that this function will return false when passed a value that occurs within the current second.
  • dateTime: A datetime, or datetimezone value to be evaluated.
Determine if the second before the current system time is in the previous second.

DateTime.Time_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the time part of the given datetime value.

DateTime.Time_Documentation.LongDescript.message: Returns the time part of the given datetime value, dateTime.

DateTime.ToRecord_Documentation.Descript.message: Returns a record containing the datetime value's parts.

DateTime.ToRecord_Documentation.LongDesc.message:
Returns a record containing the parts of the given datetime value, dateTime.
  • dateTime: A datetime value for from which the record of its parts is to be calculated.

DateTime.ToRecord_Documentation.Examples.message: Convert the #datetime(2011, 12, 31, 11, 56, 2) value into a record containing Date and Time values.

[
      Year = 2011,
      Month = 12,
      Day = 31,
      Hour = 11,
      Minute = 56,
      Second = 2
]

DateTime.ToText_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns a textual representation of the datetime value.

DateTime.ToText_Documentation.LongDescri.message:
Returns a textual representation of dateTime. An optional record parameter, options, may be provided to specify additional properties. culture is only used for legacy workflows. The record can contain the following fields:
  • Format: A text value indicating the format to use. For more details, go to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180104 and https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180105. Omitting this field or providing null will result in formatting the date using the default defined by Culture.
  • Culture: When Format is not null, Culture controls some format specifiers. For example, in "en-US" "MMM" is "Jan", "Feb", "Mar", ..., while in "ru-RU" "MMM" is "", "", "", .... When Format is null, Culture controls the default format to use. When Culture is null or omitted, Culture.Current is used.
To support legacy workflows, options and culture may also be text values. This has the same behavior as if options = [Format = options, Culture = culture].

DateTime.ToText_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Convert #datetime(2010, 12, 31, 01, 30, 25) into a text value. Result output may vary depending on current culture.

DateTime.ToText_Documentation.Examples_1.message: Convert using a custom format and the German culture.

DateTimeZone.From_Documentation.Descript.message: Creates a datetimezone from the given value.

DateTimeZone.From_Documentation.LongDesc.message:
Returns a datetimezone value from the given value. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US"). If the given value is null, DateTimeZone.From returns null. If the given value is datetimezone, value is returned. Values of the following types can be converted to a datetimezone value:
  • text: A datetimezone value from textual representation. Refer to DateTimeZone.FromText for details.
  • date: A datetimezone with value as the date component, 12:00:00 AM as the time component, and the offset corresponding the local time zone.
  • datetime: A datetimezone with value as the datetime and the offset corresponding the local time zone.
  • time: A datetimezone with the date equivalent of the OLE Automation Date of 0 as the date component, value as the time component, and the offset corresponding the local time zone.
  • number: A datetimezone with the datetime equivalent of the OLE Automation Date expressed by value and the offset corresponding the local time zone.
If value is of any other type, an error is returned.

DateTimeZone.FromFileTime_Documentation..message: Creates a datetimezone from a 64 bits long number.

Creates a datetimezone value from the fileTime value and converts it to the local time zone. The filetime is a Windows file time value that represents the number of 100-nanosecond intervals that have elapsed since 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

DateTimeZone.FromText_Documentation.Desc.message: Creates a datetimezone from local, universal, and custom datetimezone formats.

DateTimeZone.FromText_Documentation.Long.message:
Creates a datetimezone value from a textual representation, text. An optional record parameter, options, may be provided to specify additional properties. The record can contain the following fields:
  • Format: A text value indicating the format to use. For more details, go to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180104 and https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180105. Omitting this field or providing null will result in parsing the date using a best effort.
  • Culture: When Format is not null, Culture controls some format specifiers. For example, in "en-US" "MMM" is "Jan", "Feb", "Mar", ..., while in "ru-RU" "MMM" is "", "", "", .... When Format is null, Culture controls the default format to use. When Culture is null or omitted, Culture.Current is used.
To support legacy workflows, options may also be a text value. This has the same behavior as if options = [Format = null, Culture = options].

DateTimeZone.FromText_Documentation.Exam.message: Convert using a custom format and the German culture.
DateTimeZone.FromText("30 Dez 2010 02:04:50.369730 +02:00", [Format="dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss.ffffff zzz", Culture="de-DE"])

DateTimeZone.RemoveZone_Documentation.De.message: Removes timezone information from the given datetimezone value.

DateTimeZone.RemoveZone_Documentation.Lo.message: Returns a #datetime value from dateTimeZone with timezone information removed.

DateTimeZone.RemoveZone_Documentation.Ex.message: Remove timezone information from the value  #datetimezone(2011, 12, 31, 9, 15, 36, -7, 0).

DateTimeZone.ToLocal_Documentation.Descr.message: Converts the timezone component to the local timezone.

DateTimeZone.ToLocal_Documentation.LongD.message: Changes timezone information of the datetimezone value dateTimeZone to the local timezone information. If dateTimeZone does not have a timezone component, the local timezone information is added.

DateTimeZone.ToLocal_Documentation.Examp.message: Change timezone information for #datetimezone(2010, 12, 31, 11, 56, 02, 7, 30) to local timezone (assuming PST).

DateTimeZone.ToRecord_Documentation.Desc.message: Returns a record containing the datetimezone value's parts.

DateTimeZone.ToRecord_Documentation.Long.message:
Returns a record containing the parts of the given datetimezone value, dateTimeZone.
  • dateTimeZone: A datetimezone value for from which the record of its parts is to be calculated.

DateTimeZone.ToRecord_Documentation.Exam.message: Convert the #datetimezone(2011, 12, 31, 11, 56, 2, 8, 0) value into a record containing Date, Time, and Zone values.

[
      Year = 2011,
      Month = 12,
      Day = 31,
      Hour = 11,
      Minute = 56,
      Second = 2,
      ZoneHours = 8,
      ZoneMinutes = 0
]

DateTimeZone.ToText_Documentation.Descri.message: Returns a textual representation of the datetimezone value.

DateTimeZone.ToText_Documentation.LongDe.message:
Returns a textual representation of dateTimeZone. An optional record parameter, options, may be provided to specify additional properties. culture is only used for legacy workflows. The record can contain the following fields:
  • Format: A text value indicating the format to use. For more details, go to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180104 and https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180105. Omitting this field or providing null will result in formatting the date using the default defined by Culture.
  • Culture: When Format is not null, Culture controls some format specifiers. For example, in "en-US" "MMM" is "Jan", "Feb", "Mar", ..., while in "ru-RU" "MMM" is "", "", "", .... When Format is null, Culture controls the default format to use. When Culture is null or omitted, Culture.Current is used.
To support legacy workflows, options and culture may also be text values. This has the same behavior as if options = [Format = options, Culture = culture].

DateTimeZone.ToText_Documentation.Exampl.message: Convert #datetimezone(2010, 12, 31, 01, 30, 25, 2, 0) into a text value. Result output may vary depending on current culture.
Convert using a custom format and the German culture.
DateTimeZone.ToText(#datetimezone(2010, 12, 30, 2, 4, 50.36973, -8,0), [Format="dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss.ffffff zzz", Culture="de-DE"])

DateTimeZone.ToUtc_Documentation.Descrip.message: Converts the timezone component to UTC timezone.

DateTimeZone.ToUtc_Documentation.LongDes.message: Changes timezone information of the datetime value dateTimeZone to the UTC or Universal Time timezone information. If dateTimeZone does not have a timezone component, the UTC timezone information is added.

DateTimeZone.ToUtc_Documentation.Example.message: Change timezone information for #datetimezone(2010, 12, 31, 11, 56, 02, 7, 30) to UTC timezone.

DateTimeZone.ZoneHours_Documentation.Des.message: Changes the timezone of the value.

DateTimeZone.ZoneMinutes_Documentation.L.message: Changes the timezone of the value.

Decimal.From_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a Decimal from the given value.

Decimal.From_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns a Decimal number value from the given value. If the given value is null, Decimal.From returns null. If the given value is number within the range of Decimal, value is returned, otherwise an error is returned. If value is of any other type, it will first be converted to a number using Number.FromText. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US").

DeltaLake.Table_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns the contents of the Delta Lake table.

DeltaLake.Table_Documentation.LongDescri.message: Returns the contents of the Delta Lake table.

Double.From_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a Double from the given value.

Double.From_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Returns a Double number value from the given value. If the given value is null, Double.From returns null. If the given value is number within the range of Double, value is returned, otherwise an error is returned. If value is of any other type, it will first be converted to a number using Number.FromText. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US").

Duration.Days_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the days portion of a duration.

Duration.Days_Documentation.Examples_0_D.message: Extract the number of days between two dates.

Duration.From_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a duration from the given value.

Duration.From_Documentation.LongDescript.message:
Returns a duration value from the given value. If the given value is null, Duration.From returns null. If the given value is duration, value is returned. Values of the following types can be converted to a duration value:
  • text: A duration value from textual elapsed time forms (d.h:m:s). Refer to Duration.FromText for details.
  • number: A duration equivalent to the number of whole and fractional days expressed by value.
If value is of any other type, an error is returned.

Duration.FromText_Documentation.Descript.message: Returns a duration value from textual elapsed time forms (d.h:m:s).

Duration.FromText_Documentation.LongDesc.message:
Returns a duration value from the specified text, text. The following formats can be parsed by this function:
  • (-)hh:mm(:ss(.ff))
  • (-)ddd(.hh:mm(:ss(.ff)))

(All ranges are inclusive)
ddd: Number of days.
hh: Number of hours, between 0 and 23.
mm: Number of minutes, between 0 and 59.
ss: Number of seconds, between 0 and 59.
ff: Fraction of seconds, between 0 and 9999999.

Duration.Hours_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the hours portion of a duration.

Duration.Hours_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Extract the hours from a duration value.

Duration.Minutes_Documentation.Descripti.message: Returns the minutes portion of a duration.

Duration.Seconds_Documentation.Descripti.message: Returns the seconds portion of a duration.

Duration.ToRecord_Documentation.Examples.message: Convert #duration(2, 5, 55, 20) into a record of its parts including days, hours, minutes and seconds if applicable.

Duration.ToText_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns the text of the form "d.h:m:s".

Duration.ToText_Documentation.LongDescri.message:
Returns a textual representation in the form "day.hour:mins:sec" of the given duration value, duration.
  • duration: A duration from which the textual representation is calculated.
  • format: [Optional] Deprecated, will throw an error if not null

Geography.FromWellKnownText_Documentatio.message: Translates text representing a geographic value in Well-Known Text (WKT) format into a structured record.

Translates text representing a geographic value in Well-Known Text (WKT) format into a structured record. WKT is a standard format defined by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) and is the typical serialization format used by databases including SQL Server.

Geography.ToWellKnownText_Documentation..message: Translates a structured geographic point value into its Well-Known Text (WKT) representation.

Translates a structured geographic point value into its Well-Known Text (WKT) representation as defined by the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC), also the serialization format used by many databases including SQL Server.

Guid.From_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a guid value from the given value.

Guid.From_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns a Guid.Type value from the given value. If the given value is null, Guid.From returns null. A check will be performed to determine if the given value is in an acceptable format. Acceptable formats provided in the examples.

Guid.From_Documentation.Examples_0_Descr.message: The Guid can be provided as 32 contiguous hexadecimal digits.

Guid.From_Documentation.Examples_1_Descr.message: The Guid can be provided as 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens into blocks of 8-4-4-4-12.

Guid.From_Documentation.Examples_2_Descr.message: The Guid can be provided as 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens and enclosed in braces.

Guid.From_Documentation.Examples_3_Descr.message: The Guid can be provided as 32 hexadecimal digits separated by hyphens and enclosed by parentheses.

Int16.From_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a 16-bit integer from the given value.

Int16.From_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns a 16-bit integer number value from the given value. If the given value is null, Int16.From returns null. If the given value is number within the range of 16-bit integer without a fractional part, value is returned. If it has fractional part, then the number is rounded with the rounding mode specified. The default rounding mode is RoundingMode.ToEven. If value is of any other type, it will first be converted to a number using Number.FromText. Refer to Number.Round for the available rounding modes. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US").

Int16.From_Documentation.Examples_1_Desc.message: Get the 16-bit integer number value of "4.5" using RoundingMode.AwayFromZero.

Int32.From_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a 32-bit integer from the given value.

Int32.From_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns a 32-bit integer number value from the given value. If the given value is null, Int32.From returns null. If the given value is number within the range of 32-bit integer without a fractional part, value is returned. If it has fractional part, then the number is rounded with the rounding mode specified. The default rounding mode is RoundingMode.ToEven. If value is of any other type, it will first be converted to a number using Number.FromText. Refer to Number.Round for the available rounding modes. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US").

Int32.From_Documentation.Examples_1_Desc.message: Get the 32-bit integer number value of "4.5" using RoundingMode.AwayFromZero.

Int64.From_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a 64-bit integer from the given value.

Int64.From_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns a 64-bit integer number value from the given value. If the given value is null, Int64.From returns null. If the given value is number within the range of 64-bit integer without a fractional part, value is returned. If it has fractional part, then the number is rounded with the rounding mode specified. The default rounding mode is RoundingMode.ToEven. If value is of any other type, it will first be converted to a number using Number.FromText. Refer to Number.Round for the available rounding modes. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US").

Int64.From_Documentation.Examples_1_Desc.message: Get the 64-bit integer number value of "4.5" using RoundingMode.AwayFromZero.

Int8.From_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a signed 8-bit integer from the given value.

Int8.From_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns a signed 8-bit integer number value from the given value. If the given value is null, Int8.From returns null. If the given value is number within the range of signed 8-bit integer without a fractional part, value is returned. If it has fractional part, then the number is rounded with the rounding mode specified. The default rounding mode is RoundingMode.ToEven. If value is of any other type, it will first be converted to a number using Number.FromText. Refer to Number.Round for the available rounding modes. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US").

Int8.From_Documentation.Examples_0_Descr.message: Get the signed 8-bit integer number value of "4".

Int8.From_Documentation.Examples_1_Descr.message: Get the signed 8-bit integer number value of "4.5" using RoundingMode.AwayFromZero.

ItemExpression.From_Documentation.Descri.message: Returns the abstract syntax tree (AST) for the body of a function.

ItemExpression.From_Documentation.LongDe.message:
Returns the abstract syntax tree (AST) for the body of function, normalized into an item expression:

  • The function must be a 1-argument lambda.
  • All references to the function parameter are replaced with ItemExpression.Item.
  • The AST will be simplified to contain only nodes of the kinds:
    • Constant
    • Invocation
    • Unary
    • Binary
    • If
    • FieldAccess

An error is raised if an item expression AST cannot be returned for the body of function.

ItemExpression.From_Documentation.Exampl.message: Returns the AST for the body of the function each _ <> null

[
    Kind = "Binary",
    Operator = "NotEquals",
    Left = ItemExpression.Item,
    Right =
    [
        Kind = "Constant",
        Value = null
    ]
]

Json.Document_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the content of the JSON document.

Json.Document_Documentation.LongDescript.message: Returns the content of the JSON document.

Json.FromValue_Documentation.Description.message: Produces a JSON representation of a given value.

Json.FromValue_Documentation.LongDescrip.message:
Produces a JSON representation of a given value value with a text encoding specified by encoding. If encoding is omitted, UTF8 is used. Values are represented as follows:

  • Null, text and logical values are represented as the corresponding JSON types
  • Numbers are represented as numbers in JSON, except that #infinity, -#infinity and #nan are converted to null
  • Lists are represented as JSON arrays
  • Records are represnted as JSON objects
  • Tables are represented as an array of objects
  • Dates, times, datetimes, datetimezones and durations are represented as ISO-8601 text
  • Binary values are represented as base-64 encoded text
  • Types and functions produce an error

Json.FromValue_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Convert a complex value to JSON.

Lines.FromBinary_Documentation.Descripti.message: Converts a binary value to a list of text values split at lines breaks.  If a quote style is specified, then line breaks may appear within quotes.  If includeLineSeparators is true, then the line break characters are included in the text.

Lines.FromBinary_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Converts a binary value to a list of text values split at lines breaks.  If a quote style is specified, then line breaks may appear within quotes.  If includeLineSeparators is true, then the line break characters are included in the text.

Lines.FromText_Documentation.Description.message: Converts a text value to a list of text values split at lines breaks. If includeLineSeparators is true, then the line break characters are included in the text.

Lines.FromText_Documentation.LongDescrip.message:
Converts a text value to a list of text values split at lines breaks. If includeLineSeparators is true, then the line break characters are included in the text.
  • QuoteStyle.None: (default) No quoting behavior is needed.
  • QuoteStyle.Csv: Quoting is as per Csv. A double quote character is used to demarcate such regions, and a pair of double quote characters is used to indicate a single double quote character within such a region.

Lines.ToBinary_Documentation.Description.message: Converts a list of text into a binary value using the specified encoding and lineSeparator.The specified lineSeparator is appended to each line.  If not specified then the carriage return and line feed characters are used.

Lines.ToBinary_Documentation.LongDescrip.message: Converts a list of text into a binary value using the specified encoding and lineSeparator.The specified lineSeparator is appended to each line.  If not specified then the carriage return and line feed characters are used.

Lines.ToText_Documentation.Description.message: Converts a list of text into a single text.  The specified lineSeparator is appended to each line.  If not specified then the carriage return and line feed characters are used.

Lines.ToText_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Converts a list of text into a single text.  The specified lineSeparator is appended to each line.  If not specified then the carriage return and line feed characters are used.

List.AllTrue_Documentation.Description.message: Returns true if all expressions are true.

List.AllTrue_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns true if all expressions in the list list are true.

List.AllTrue_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Determine if all the expressions in the list {true, true, 2 > 0} are true.

List.AllTrue_Documentation.Examples_1_De.message: Determine if all the expressions in the list {true, true, 2 < 0} are true.

List.AnyTrue_Documentation.Description.message: Returns true if any expression is true.

List.AnyTrue_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns true if any expression in the list list is true.

List.AnyTrue_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Determine if any of the expressions in the list {true, false, 2 > 0} are true.

List.AnyTrue_Documentation.Examples_1_De.message: Determine if any of the expressions in the list {2 = 0, false, 2 < 0} are true.

List.Average_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the average of the values. Works with number, date, datetime, datetimezone and duration values.

List.Average_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns the average value for the items in the list, list. The result is given in the same datatype as the values in the list. Only works with number, date, time, datetime, datetimezone and duration values. If the list is empty null is returned.

List.Average_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Find the average of the list of numbers, {3, 4, 6}.

List.Average_Documentation.Examples_1_De.message: Find the average of the date values January 1, 2011, January 2, 2011 and January 3, 2011.

List.Buffer_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Buffers the list list in memory. The result of this call is a stable list.

List.Buffer_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Create a stable copy of the list {1..10}.

List.Combine_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a single list by combining multiple lists.

List.Combine_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Takes a list of lists, lists, and merges them into a single new list.

List.Combine_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Combine the two simple lists {1, 2} and {3, 4}.

List.Combine_Documentation.Examples_1_De.message: Combine the two lists, {1, 2} and {3, {4, 5}}, one of which contains a nested list.

List.Count_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the number of items in the list.

List.Count_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the number of items in the list list.

List.Count_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Find the number of values in the list {1, 2, 3}.

List.Distinct_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list of values with duplicates removed.

List.Distinct_Documentation.LongDescript.message: Returns a list that contains all the values in list list with duplicates removed. If the list is empty, the result is an empty list.

List.Distinct_Documentation.Examples_0_D.message: Remove the duplicates from the list {1, 1, 2, 3, 3, 3}.

List.First_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the first value of the list or the specified default if empty.

List.First_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the first item in the list list, or the optional default value, defaultValue, if the list is empty. If the list is empty and a default value is not specified, the function returns null.

List.First_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Find the first value in the list {1, 2, 3}.

List.First_Documentation.Examples_1_Desc.message: Find the first value in the list {}. If the list is empty, return -1.

List.Intersect_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the intersection of the list values found in the input.

List.Intersect_Documentation.LongDescrip.message: Returns the intersection of the list values found in the input list lists. An optional parameter, equationCriteria, can be specified.

List.Intersect_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Find the intersection of the lists {1..5}, {2..6}, {3..7}.

List.IsDistinct_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Indicates whether there are duplicates in the list.

List.IsDistinct_Documentation.LongDescri.message: Returns a logical value whether there are duplicates in the list list; true if the list is distinct, false if there are duplicate values.

List.IsDistinct_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Find if the list {1, 2, 3} is distinct (i.e. no duplicates).

List.IsDistinct_Documentation.Examples_1.message: Find if the list {1, 2, 3, 3} is distinct (i.e. no duplicates).

List.IsEmpty_Documentation.Description.message: Returns true if the list is empty.

List.IsEmpty_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns true if the list, list, contains no values (length 0). If the list contains values (length > 0), returns false.

List.IsEmpty_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Find if the list {} is empty.

List.IsEmpty_Documentation.Examples_1_De.message: Find if the list {1, 2} is empty.

List.Last_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the last value of the list or the specified default if empty.

List.Last_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the last item in the list list, or the optional default value, defaultValue, if the list is empty. If the list is empty and a default value is not specified, the function returns null.

List.Last_Documentation.Examples_0_Descr.message: Find the last value in the list {1, 2, 3}.

List.Last_Documentation.Examples_1_Descr.message: Find the last value in the list {} or -1 if it empty.

List.LastN_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the last value in the list.  Can optionally specify how many values to return or a qualifying condition.

List.LastN_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Returns the last item of the list list. If the list is empty, an exception is thrown. This function takes an optional parameter, countOrCondition, to support gathering multiple items or filtering items. countOrCondition can be specified in three ways:
  • If a number is specified, up to that many items are returned.
  • If a condition is specified, all items are returned that initially meet the condition, starting at the end of the list. Once an item fails the condition, no further items are considered.
  • If this parameter is null the last item in the list is returned.

List.LastN_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Find the last value in the list {3, 4, 5, -1, 7, 8, 2}.

List.LastN_Documentation.Examples_1_Desc.message: Find the last values in the list {3, 4, 5, -1, 7, 8, 2} that are greater than 0.

List.Max_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the maximum value or the default value for an empty list.

List.Max_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the maximum item in the list list, or the optional default value default if the list is empty. An optional comparisonCriteria value, comparisonCriteria, may be specified to determine how to compare the items in the list. If this parameter is null, the default comparer is used.

List.Max_Documentation.Examples_0_Descri.message: Find the max in the list {1, 4, 7, 3, -2, 5}.

List.Max_Documentation.Examples_1_Descri.message: Find the max in the list {} or return -1 if it is empty.

List.Median_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the median value in the list.

List.Median_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Returns the median item of the list list. This function returns null if the list contains no non-null values. If there is an even number of items, the function chooses the smaller of the two median items unless the list is comprised entirely of datetimes, durations, numbers or times, in which case it returns the average of the two items.

List.Median_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Find the median of the list {5, 3, 1, 7, 9}.

List.Min_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the minimum value or the default value for an empty list.

List.Min_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the minimum item in the list list, or the optional default value default if the list is empty. An optional comparisonCriteria value, comparisonCriteria, may be specified to determine how to compare the items in the list. If this parameter is null, the default comparer is used.

List.Min_Documentation.Examples_0_Descri.message: Find the min in the list {1, 4, 7, 3, -2, 5}.

List.Min_Documentation.Examples_1_Descri.message: Find the min in the list {} or return -1 if it is empty.

List.Mode_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the most frequent value in the list.

List.Mode_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the item that appears most frequently in the list, list. If the list is empty an exception is thrown. If multiple items appear with the same maximum frequency, the last one is chosen. An optional comparisonCriteria value, equationCriteria, can be specified to control equality testing.

List.Mode_Documentation.Examples_0_Descr.message: Find the item that appears most frequently in the list {"A", 1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 5}.

List.Mode_Documentation.Examples_1_Descr.message: Find the item that appears most frequently in the list {"A", 1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 5, 5}.

List.Modes_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list of the most frequent values in the list.

List.Modes_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the item that appears most frequently in the list, list. If the list is empty an exception is thrown. If multiple items appear with the same maximum frequency, the last one is chosen. An optional comparisonCriteria value, equationCriteria, can be specified to control equality testing.

List.Modes_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Find the items that appears most frequently in the list {"A", 1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 5, 5}.

List.NonNullCount_Documentation.Descript.message: Returns the number of non-null items in the list.

List.NonNullCount_Documentation.LongDesc.message: Returns the number of non-null items in the list list.

List.Positions_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list of offsets for the input.

List.Positions_Documentation.LongDescrip.message: Returns a list of offsets for the input list list. When using List.Transform to change a list, the list of positions can be used to give the transform access to the position.

List.Positions_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Find the offsets of values in the list {1, 2, 3, 4, null, 5}.

List.Product_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the product of the numbers in the list.

List.Product_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns the product of the non-null numbers in the list, numbersList. Returns null if there are no non-null values in the list.

List.Product_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Find the product of the numbers in the list {1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 5, 5}.

List.Random_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list of random numbers.

List.Random_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message:
Returns a list of random numbers between 0 and 1, given the number of values to generate and an optional seed value.
  • count: The number of random values to generate.
  • seed: [Optional] A numeric value used to seed the random number generator. If omitted a unique list of random numbers is generated each time you call the function. If you specify the seed value with a number every call to the function generates the same list of random numbers.

List.Random_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Create a list of 3 random numbers.

List.Random_Documentation.Examples_1_Des.message: Create a list of 3 random numbers, specifying seed value.

List.RemoveFirstN_Documentation.Descript.message: Returns a list that skips the specified number of elements at the beginning of the list.

List.RemoveFirstN_Documentation.LongDesc.message:
Returns a list that removes the first element of list list. If list is an empty list an empty list is returned. This function takes an optional parameter, countOrCondition, to support removing multiple values as listed below.
  • If a number is specified, up to that many items are removed.
  • If a condition is specified, the returned list begins with the first element in list that meets the criteria. Once an item fails the condition, no further items are considered.
  • If this parameter is null, the default behavior is observed.

List.RemoveFirstN_Documentation.Examples.message: Create a list from {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} without the first 3 numbers.
Create a list from {5, 4, 2, 6, 1} that starts with a number less than 3.

List.RemoveLastN_Documentation.Descripti.message: Returns a list that removes the specified number of elements from the end of the list.

List.RemoveLastN_Documentation.LongDescr.message:
Returns a list that removes the last countOrCondition elements from the end of list list. If list has less than countOrCondition elements, an empty list is returned.
  • If a number is specified, up to that many items are removed.
  • If a condition is specified, the returned list ends with the first element from the bottom in list that meets the criteria. Once an item fails the condition, no further items are considered.
  • If this parameter is null, only one item is removed.

List.RemoveLastN_Documentation.Examples_.message: Create a list from {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} without the last 3 numbers.
Create a list from {5, 4, 2, 6, 4} that ends with a number less than 3.

List.RemoveNulls_Documentation.Descripti.message: Removes all "null" values from the specified list.

List.RemoveNulls_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Removes all occurrences of "null" values in the list. If there are no 'null' values in the list, the original list is returned.

List.RemoveNulls_Documentation.Examples_.message: Remove the "null" values from the list {1, 2, 3, null, 4, 5, null, 6}.

List.Reverse_Documentation.Description.message: Reverses the order of values in the list.

List.Reverse_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns a list with the values in the list list in reversed order.

List.Reverse_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Create a list from {1..10} in reverse order.

List.Single_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the one list item for a list of length one, otherwise throws an exception.

List.Single_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: If there is only one item in the list list, returns that item. If there is more than one item or the list is empty, the function throws an exception.

List.Single_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Find the single value in the list {1}.

List.Single_Documentation.Examples_1_Des.message: Find the single value in the list {1, 2, 3}.

List.Single_Documentation.Examples_1_Res.message: [Expression.Error] There were too many elements in the enumeration to complete the operation.

List.SingleOrDefault_Documentation.Descr.message: Returns the one list item for a list of length one and the default value for an empty list.

List.SingleOrDefault_Documentation.LongD.message: If there is only one item in the list list, returns that item. If the list is empty, the function returns null unless an optional default is specified. If there is more than one item in the list, the function returns an error.

List.SingleOrDefault_Documentation.Examp.message: Find the single value in the list {1}.
Find the single value in the list {}.
Find the single value in the list {}. If is empty, return -1.

List.Skip_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list that skips the specified number of elements at the beginning of the list.

List.Skip_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Returns a list that skips the first element of list list. If list is an empty list an empty list is returned. This function takes an optional parameter, countOrCondition, to support skipping multiple values as listed below.
  • If a number is specified, up to that many items are skipped.
  • If a condition is specified, the returned list begins with the first element in list that meets the criteria. Once an item fails the condition, no further items are considered.
  • If this parameter is null, the default behavior is observed.

List.Skip_Documentation.Examples_0_Descr.message: Create a list from {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} without the first 3 numbers.

List.Skip_Documentation.Examples_1_Descr.message: Create a list from {5, 4, 2, 6, 1} that starts with a number less than 3.

List.Sort_Documentation.Description.message: Sorts a list of data according to the criteria specified.

List.Sort_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Sorts a list of data, list, according to the optional criteria specified. An optional parameter, comparisonCriteria, can be specified as the comparison criterion. This can take the following values:
  • To control the order, the comparison criterion can be an Order enum value. (Order.Descending, Order.Ascending).
  • To compute a key to be used for sorting, a function of 1 argument can be used.
  • To both select a key and control order, comparison criterion can be a list containing the key and order ({each 1 / _, Order.Descending}).
  • To completely control the comparison, a function of 2 arguments can be used. This function will be passed two items from the list (any two items, in any order). The function should return one of the following values:
    • -1: The first item is less than the second item.
    • 0: The items are equal.
    • 1: The first item is greater than the second item.
    Value.Compare is a method that can be used to delegate this logic.

List.Sort_Documentation.Examples_1_Descr.message: Sort the list {2, 3, 1} in descending order.

List.Sort_Documentation.Examples_2_Descr.message: Sort the list {2, 3, 1} in descending order using the Value.Compare method.

List.StandardDeviation_Documentation.Des.message: Returns a sample based estimate of the standard deviation.

List.StandardDeviation_Documentation.Lon.message: Returns a sample based estimate of the standard deviation of the values in the list, numbersList. If numbersList is a list of numbers, a number is returned. An exception is thrown on an empty list or a list of items that is not type number.

List.StandardDeviation_Documentation.Exa.message: Find the standard deviation of the numbers 1 through 5.

List.Sum_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the sum of the items in the list.

List.Sum_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the sum of the non-null values in the list, list. Returns null if there are no non-null values in the list.

List.Sum_Documentation.Examples_0_Descri.message: Find the sum of the numbers in the list {1, 2, 3}.

List.Union_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the union of the list values found in the input.

List.Union_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Takes a list of lists lists, unions the items in the individual lists and returns them in the output list. As a result, the returned list contains all items in any input lists. This operation maintains traditional bag semantics, so duplicate values are matched as part of the Union. An optional equation criteria value, equationCriteria, can be specified to control equality testing.

List.Union_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Create a union of the list {1..5}, {2..6}, {3..7}.

List.Zip_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list of lists by combining items at the same position in multiple lists.

List.Zip_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Takes a list of lists, lists, and returns a list of lists combining items at the same position.

List.Zip_Documentation.Examples_0_Descri.message: Zips the two simple lists {1, 2} and {3, 4}.

List.Zip_Documentation.Examples_1_Descri.message: Zips the two simple lists of different lengths {1, 2} and {3}.

Logical.From_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a logical from the given value.

Logical.From_Documentation.LongDescripti.message:
Returns a logical value from the given value. If the given value is null, Logical.From returns null. If the given value is logical, value is returned. Values of the following types can be converted to a logical value:
  • text: A logical value from the text value, either "true" or "false". Refer to Logical.FromText for details.
  • number: false if value equals 0, true otherwise.
If value is of any other type, an error is returned.

Logical.FromText_Documentation.Descripti.message: Creates a logical value from the text values "true" and "false".

Logical.FromText_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Creates a logical value from the text value text, either "true" or "false". If text contains a different string, an exception is thrown. The text value text is case insensitive.

Logical.FromText_Documentation.Examples_.message: Create a logical value from the text string "true".
Create a logical value from the text string "a".
[Expression.Error] Could not convert to a logical.

Logical.ToText_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the text "true" or "false" given a logical value.

Logical.ToText_Documentation.LongDescrip.message: Creates a text value from the logical value logicalValue, either true or false. If logicalValue is not a logical value, an exception is thrown.

Logical.ToText_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Create a text value from the logical true.

Number.Abs_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the absolute value of the number.

Number.Abs_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Returns the absolute value of number. If number is null, Number.Abs returns null.
  • number: A number for which the absolute value is to be calculated.

Number.Acos_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the arccosine of the number.

Number.Asin_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the arcsine of the number.

Number.Atan_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the arctangent of the number.

Number.BitwiseNot_Documentation.Descript.message: Returns a byte where each bit is the opposite of the input.

Number.BitwiseNot_Documentation.LongDesc.message: Returns the result of performing a bitwise "Not" operation on number.

Number.Cos_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the cosine of the number.

Number.Cos_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Find the cosine of the angle 0.

Number.Cosh_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of the number.

Number.Exp_Documentation.Description.message: Raises e to the given power.

Number.Exp_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Returns the result of raising e to the power of number (exponential function).
  • number: A number for which the exponential function is to be calculated. If number is null, Number.Exp returns null.

Number.Exp_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Raise e to the power of 3.

Number.Factorial_Documentation.Descripti.message: Returns the factorial of the number.

Number.Factorial_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Returns the factorial of the number number.

Number.From_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a number from the given value.

Number.From_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message:
Returns a number value from the given value. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US"). If the given value is null, Number.From returns null. If the given value is number, value is returned. Values of the following types can be converted to a number value:
  • text: A number value from textual representation. Common text formats are handled ("15", "3,423.10", "5.0E-10"). Refer to Number.FromText for details.
  • logical: 1 for true, 0 for false.
  • datetime: A double-precision floating-point number that contains an OLE Automation date equivalent.
  • datetimezone: A double-precision floating-point number that contains an OLE Automation date equivalent of the local date and time of value.
  • date: A double-precision floating-point number that contains an OLE Automation date equivalent.
  • time: Expressed in fractional days.
  • duration: Expressed in whole and fractional days.
If value is of any other type, an error is returned.

Number.FromText_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Creates numbers from common text formats ("15", "3,423.10", "5.0E-10").

Number.FromText_Documentation.LongDescri.message:
Returns a number value from the given text value, text.
  • text: The textual representation of a number value. The representation must be in a common number format, such as "15", "3,423.10", or "5.0E-10".
  • culture: An optional culture that controls how text is interpreted (for example, "en-US").

Number.Round_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the rounded number. The number of digits and rounding mode can be specified.

Number.Round_Documentation.LongDescripti.message:
Returns the result of rounding number to the nearest number. If number is null, Number.Round returns null.

By default, number is rounded to the nearest integer, and ties are broken by rounding to the nearest even number (using RoundingMode.ToEven, also known as "banker's rounding").

However, these defaults can be overridden via the following optional parameters.
  • digits: Causes number to be rounded to the specified number of decimal digits.
  • roundingMode: Overrides the default tie-breaking behavior when number is at the midpoint between two potential rounded values (refer to RoundingMode.Type for possible values).

Number.Round_Documentation.Examples_3_De.message: Round 1.2345 to three decimal places (Rounding up).

Number.Round_Documentation.Examples_4_De.message: Round 1.2345 to three decimal places (Rounding down).

Number.RoundAwayFromZero_Documentation.D.message: Returns the result of rounding positive numbers up and negative numbers down. The number of digits can be specified.

Number.RoundAwayFromZero_Documentation.L.message: Returns the result of rounding number based on the sign of the number. This function will round positive numbers up and negative numbers down. If digits is specified, number is rounded to the digits number of decimal digits.

Number.RoundAwayFromZero_Documentation.E.message: Round the number -1.2 away from zero.
Round the number 1.2 away from zero.
Round the number -1.234 to two decimal places away from zero.

Number.RoundDown_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Returns the result of rounding number down to the previous highest integer. If number is null, this function returns null. If digits is provided, number is rounded to the specified number of decimal digits.

An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US") to control the culture-dependent behavior of format.

OData.Feed_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a table of OData feeds offered by an OData service.

OData.Feed_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Returns a table of OData feeds offered by an OData service from a uri serviceUri, headers headers. A boolean value specifying whether to use concurrent connections or an optional record parameter, options, may be specified to control the following options:
  • Query: Programmatically add query parameters to the URL without having to worry about escaping.
  • Headers : Specifying this value as a record will supply additional headers to an HTTP request.
  • ExcludedFromCacheKey: Specifying this value as a list will exclude these HTTP header keys from being part of the calculation for caching data.
  • ApiKeyName : If the target site has a notion of an API key, this parameter can be used to specify the name (not the value) of the key parameter that must be used in the URL. The actual key value is provided in the credential.
  • Timeout : Specifying this value as a duration will change the timeout for an HTTP request. The default value is 600 seconds.
  • EnableBatch : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to allow generation of an OData $batch request if the MaxUriLength is exceeded (default is false).
  • MaxUriLength : A number that indicates the max length of an allowed uri sent to an OData service. If exceeded and EnableBatch is true then the request will be made to an OData $batch endpoint, otherwise it will fail (default is 2048).
  • Concurrent : A logical (true/false) when set to true, requests to the service will be made concurrently. When set to false, requests will be made sequentially. When not specified, the value will be determined by the services AsynchronousRequestsSupported annotation. If the service does not specify whether AsynchronousRequestsSupported is supported, requests will be made sequentially.
  • ODataVersion : A number (3 or 4) that specifies the OData protocol version to use for this OData service. When not specified, all supported versions will be requested. The service version will be determined by the OData-Version header returned by the service.
  • FunctionOverloads : A logical (true/false) when set to true, function import overloads will be listed in the navigator as separate entries, when set to false, function import overloads will be listed as one union function in the navigator. Default value for V3: false. Default value for V4: true.
  • MoreColumns : A logical (true/false) when set to true, adds a "More Columns" column to each entity feed containing open types and polymorphic types. This will contain the fields not declared in the base type. When false, this field is not present. Defaults to false.
  • IncludeAnnotations : A comma separated list of namespace qualified term names or patterns to include with "*" as a wildcard. By default, none of the annotations are included.
  • IncludeMetadataAnnotations : A comma separated list of namespace qualified term names or patterns to include on metadata document requests, with "*" as a wildcard. By default, includes the same annotations as IncludeAnnotations.
  • OmitValues : Allows the OData service to avoid writing out certain values in responses. If acknowledged by the service, we will infer those values from the omitted fields. Options include:
    • ODataOmitValues.Nulls : Allows the OData service to omit null values.
  • Implementation : Specifies the implementation of the OData connector to use. Valid values are "2.0" or null.

OData.Feed_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Connect to the TripPin OData service.

RowExpression.Column_Documentation.Descr.message: Returns an abstract syntax tree (AST) that represents access to a column within a row expression.

RowExpression.Column_Documentation.LongD.message: Returns an abstract syntax tree (AST) that represents access to column columnName of the row within a row expression.

RowExpression.Column_Documentation.Examp.message: Creates an AST representing access of column "CustomerName".

RowExpression.From_Documentation.Descrip.message: Returns the abstract syntax tree (AST) for the body of a function.

RowExpression.From_Documentation.LongDes.message:
Returns the abstract syntax tree (AST) for the body of function, normalized into a row expression:

  • The function must be a 1-argument lambda.
  • All references to the function parameter are replaced with RowExpression.Row.
  • All references to columns are replaced with RowExpression.Column(columnName).
  • The AST will be simplified to contain only nodes of the kinds:
    • Constant
    • Invocation
    • Unary
    • Binary
    • If
    • FieldAccess

An error is raised if a row expression AST cannot be returned for the body of function.

RowExpression.From_Documentation.Example.message: Returns the AST for the body of the function each [CustomerID] = "ALFKI"

[
    Kind = "Binary",
    Operator = "Equals",
    Left = RowExpression.Column("CustomerName"),
    Right =
    [
        Kind = "Constant",
        Value = "ALFKI"
    ]
]

If value is of any other type, it will first be converted to a number using Number.FromText. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US").

Splitter.SplitTextByAnyDelimiter_Documen.message: Returns a function that splits text into a list of text at any of the specified delimiters.
Returns a function that splits text into a list of text at any of the specified delimiters.
Split the input by comma or semicolon, ignoring quotes and quoted delimiters and starting from the beginning of the input.
Split the input by comma or semicolon, ignoring quotes and quoted delimiters and starting from the end of the input.

let
    startAtEnd = true
in
    Splitter.SplitTextByAnyDelimiter({",", ";"}, QuoteStyle.Csv, startAtEnd)("a,""b;c,d")

in
    Splitter.SplitTextByEachDelimiter({",", ";"}, QuoteStyle.None, startAtEnd)("a,""b;c"",d")

Returns a function that splits text into a list of text by each specified length.

Split the input into the first three characters followed by the next two, starting from the end of the input.

    startAtEnd = true
in
    Splitter.SplitTextByLengths({5, 2}, startAtEnd)("RedmondWA98052")

Splitter.SplitTextByPositions_Documentat.message: Returns a function that splits text into a list of text at each specified position.
Returns a function that splits text into a list of text at each specified position.
Split the input at the specified positions, starting from the beginning of the input.
Split the input at the specified positions, starting from the end of the input.

let
    startAtEnd = true
in

Splitter.SplitTextByRanges_Documentation.message: Returns a function that splits text into a list of text according to the specified offsets and lengths.
Returns a function that splits text into a list of text according to the specified offsets and lengths. A null length indicates that all remaining input should be included.
Split the input by the specified position and length pairs, starting from the beginning of the input. Note that the ranges in this example overlap.
Split the input by the specified position and length pairs, starting from the end of the input.

let
    startAtEnd = true
in
    Splitter.SplitTextByRanges({{0, 5}, {6, 2}}, startAtEnd)("RedmondWA?98052")
Split the input into a fixed-length postal code followed by a variable-length city name.

Splitter.SplitTextByRepeatedLengths_Docu.message: Returns a function that splits text into a list of text after the specified length repeatedly.
Returns a function that splits text into a list of text after the specified length repeatedly.
Repeatedly split the input into chunks of three characters, starting from the beginning of the input.
Repeatedly split the input into chunks of three characters, starting from the end of the input.

let
    startAtEnd = true
in
    Splitter.SplitTextByRepeatedLengths(3, startAtEnd)("87654321")

Table.ApproximateRowCount_Documentation..message: Returns the approximate number of rows in the table.
Returns the approximate number of rows in the table, or an error if the data source doesn't support approximation.

Estimate the number of distinct combinations of city and state in a large table, which can be used as a cardinality estimate for the columns. Cardinality estimates are important enough that various data sources (such as SQL Server) support this particular approximation, often using an algorithm called HyperLogLog.

The OnInvoke handler of Table.View can be used to define a handler for the view function.

As with the handlers for built-in operations, if no OnInvoke handler is specified, or if it does not handle the view function, or if an error is raised by the handler, function is applied on top of the view.

Refer to the published Power Query custom connector documentation for a more complete description of Table.View and custom view functions.

Text.Proper_Documentation.Description.message: Capitalizes the first letter of each word.

Text.Proper_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Returns the result of capitalizing only the first letter of each word in text value text. All other letters are returned in lowercase. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US").

Text.Proper_Documentation.Examples_0_Cod.message: Text.Proper("the QUICK BrOWn fOx jUmPs oVER tHe LAzy DoG")

Text.Proper_Documentation.Examples_0_Res.message: "The Quick Brown Fox Jumps Over The Lazy Dog"

Text.ToBinary_Documentation.LongDescript.message: Encodes the given text value, text, into a binary value using the specified encoding.

Text.ToList_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list of character values from the given text value.

Text.ToList_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Returns a list of character values from the given text value text.

Text.ToList_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Create a list of character values from the text "Hello World".

Text.Trim_Documentation.Description.message: Removes all leading and trailing whitespace.

Text.Trim_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the result of removing all leading and trailing whitespace from text value text.

Text.Trim_Documentation.Examples_0_Descr.message: Remove leading and trailing whitespace from "     a b c d    ".

Text.TrimEnd_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns the result of removing all trailing whitespace from text value text.

Text.TrimEnd_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Remove trailing whitespace from "     a b c d    ".

Text.TrimStart_Documentation.LongDescrip.message: Returns the result of removing all leading whitespace from text value text.

Text.TrimStart_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Remove leading whitespace from "     a b c d    ".

Text.Upper_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the result of converting all characters in text to uppercase. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US").

Time.EndOfHour_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the end of the hour.

Time.EndOfHour_Documentation.LongDescrip.message:
Returns the end of the hour represented by dateTime, including fractional seconds. Time zone information is preserved.
  • dateTime: A time, datetime, or datetimezone value from which the end of the hour is calculated.

Time.EndOfHour_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Get the end of the hour for 5/14/2011 05:00:00 PM.

Time.EndOfHour_Documentation.Examples_1_.message: Get the end of the hour for 5/17/2011 05:00:00 PM -7:00.

Time.From_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a time from the given value.

Time.From_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Returns a time value from the given value. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US"). If the given value is null, Time.From returns null. If the given value is time, value is returned. Values of the following types can be converted to a time value:
  • text: A time value from textual representation. Refer to Time.FromText for details.
  • datetime: The time component of the value.
  • datetimezone: The time component of the local datetime equivalent of value.
  • number: A time equivalent to the number of fractional days expressed by value. If value is negative or greater or equal to 1, an error is returned.
If value is of any other type, an error is returned.

Time.FromText_Documentation.Description.message: Creates a Time from local and universal, and custom Time formats.

Time.FromText_Documentation.LongDescript.message:
Creates a time value from a textual representation, text. An optional record parameter, options, may be provided to specify additional properties. The record can contain the following fields:
  • Format: A text value indicating the format to use. For more details, go to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180104 and https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180105. Omitting this field or providing null will result in parsing the time using a best effort.
  • Culture: When Format is not null, Culture controls some format specifiers. For example, in "en-US" "tt" is "AM" or "PM", while in "ar-EG" "tt" is "" or "". When Format is null, Culture controls the default format to use. When Culture is null or omitted, Culture.Current is used.
To support legacy workflows, options may also be a text value. This has the same behavior as if options = [Format = null, Culture = options].

Time.Hour_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the hour component of the provided time, datetime, or datetimezone value, dateTime.

Time.Minute_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Returns the minute component of the provided time, datetime, or datetimezone value, dateTime.

Time.Second_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Returns the second component of the provided time, datetime, or datetimezone value, dateTime.

Time.Second_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Find the second value from a datetime value.

Time.StartOfHour_Documentation.Descripti.message: Returns the start of the hour.

Time.StartOfHour_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Returns the start of the hour represented by dateTime. dateTime must be a time, datetime or datetimezone value.

Time.StartOfHour_Documentation.Examples_.message: Find the start of the hour for October 10th, 2011, 8:10:32AM.

Time.ToRecord_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a record containing the Time value's parts.

Time.ToRecord_Documentation.LongDescript.message:
Returns a record containing the parts of the given Time value, time.
  • time: A time value for from which the record of its parts is to be calculated.

Time.ToRecord_Documentation.Examples_0_D.message: Convert the #time(11, 56, 2) value into a record containing Time values.

Time.ToText_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a textual representation of the time value.

Time.ToText_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message:
Returns a textual representation of time. An optional record parameter, options, may be provided to specify additional properties. culture is only used for legacy workflows. The record can contain the following fields:
  • Format: A text value indicating the format to use. For more details, go to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180104 and https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180105. Omitting this field or providing null will result in formatting the date using the default defined by Culture.
  • Culture: When Format is not null, Culture controls some format specifiers. For example, in "en-US" "tt" is "AM" or "PM", while in "ar-EG" "tt" is "" or "". When Format is null, Culture controls the default format to use. When Culture is null or omitted, Culture.Current is used.
To support legacy workflows, options and culture may also be text values. This has the same behavior as if options = [Format = options, Culture = culture].

Time.ToText_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Convert #time(01, 30, 25) into a text value. Result output may vary depending on current culture.

Time.ToText_Documentation.Examples_1_Des.message: Convert using a custom format and the German culture.

Type.IsNullable_Documentation.LongDescri.message: Returns true if a type is a nullable type; otherwise, false.
