  • RowSelector

Html.Table_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Returns a table from a sample html text value.

Html.Table_Documentation.Examples_1_Desc.message: Extracts all the hrefs from a sample html text value.

Identity.IsMemberOf_Documentation.Descri.message: Determines whether an identity is a member of an identity collection.

Identity.IsMemberOf_Documentation.LongDe.message: Determines whether an identity is a member of an identity collection.

Informix.Database_Documentation.Descript.message: Returns a table of SQL tables and views available in an Informix database.

Informix.Database_Documentation.LongDesc.message:
Returns a table of SQL tables and views available in an Informix database on server server in the database instance named database. The port may be optionally specified with the server, separated by a colon. An optional record parameter, options, may be specified to control the following options:
  • CreateNavigationProperties : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to generate navigation properties on the returned values (default is true).
  • NavigationPropertyNameGenerator : A function that is used for the creation of names for navigation properties.
  • Query : A native SQL query used to retrieve data. If the query produces multiple result sets, only the first will be returned.
  • CommandTimeout : A duration that controls how long the server-side query is allowed to run before it is canceled. The default value is ten minutes.
  • ConnectionTimeout : A duration that controls how long to wait before abandoning an attempt to make a connection to the server. The default value is driver-dependent.
  • HierarchicalNavigation : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to view the tables grouped by their schema names (default is false).
The record parameter is specified as [option1 = value1, option2 = value2...] or [Query = "select ..."] for example.

List.Alternate_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list comprised of all the odd numbered offset elements in a list.

List.Alternate_Documentation.LongDescrip.message:
Returns a list comprised of all the odd numbered offset elements in a list. Alternates between taking and skipping values from the list list depending on the parameters.
  • count: Specifies number of values that are skipped each time.
  • repeatInterval: An optional repeat interval to indicate how many values are added in between the skipped values.
  • offset: An option offset parameter to begin skipping the values at the initial offset.

List.Alternate_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Create a list from {1..10} that skips the first number.

List.Alternate_Documentation.Examples_1_.message: Create a list from {1..10} that skips every other number.

List.Alternate_Documentation.Examples_2_.message: Create a list from {1..10} that starts at 1 and skips every other number.

List.Alternate_Documentation.Examples_3_.message: Create a list from {1..10} that starts at 1, skips one value, keeps two values, and so on.

List.Contains_Documentation.Description.message: Indicates whether the list contains the value.

List.Contains_Documentation.LongDescript.message: Indicates whether the list list contains the value value. Returns true if value is found in the list, false otherwise. An optional equation criteria value, equationCriteria, can be specified to control equality testing.

List.ContainsAll_Documentation.Descripti.message: Indicates where a list includes all the values in another list.

List.ContainsAll_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Indicates whether the list list includes all the values in another list, values. Returns true if value is found in the list, false otherwise. An optional equation criteria value, equationCriteria, can be specified to control equality testing.

List.ContainsAll_Documentation.Examples_.message: Find out if the list {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} contains 3 and 4.
Find out if the list {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} contains 5 and 6.

List.ContainsAny_Documentation.Descripti.message: Indicates where a list includes any of the values in another list.

List.ContainsAny_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Indicates whether the list list includes any of the values in another list, values. Returns true if value is found in the list, false otherwise. An optional equation criteria value, equationCriteria, can be specified to control equality testing.

List.ContainsAny_Documentation.Examples_.message: Find out if the list {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} contains 3 or 9.
Find out if the list {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} contains 6 or 7.

List.Covariance_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns the covariance between the two lists of numbers.

List.Covariance_Documentation.LongDescri.message: Returns the covariance between two lists, numberList1 and numberList2. numberList1 and numberList2 must contain the same number of number values.

List.Covariance_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Calculate the covariance between two lists.

List.Difference_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns the difference of the two given lists.

List.Difference_Documentation.LongDescri.message: Returns the items in list list1 that do not appear in list list2. Duplicate values are supported. An optional equation criteria value, equationCriteria, can be specified to control equality testing.

List.Difference_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Find the items in list {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} that do not appear in {4, 5, 3}.

List.Difference_Documentation.Examples_1.message: Find the items in the list {1, 2} that do not appear in {1, 2, 3}.

List.FindText_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list of values (including record fields) that contain the specified text.

List.FindText_Documentation.LongDescript.message: Returns a list of the values from the list list which contained the value text.

List.FindText_Documentation.Examples_0_D.message: Find the text values in the list {"a", "b", "ab"} that match "a".

List.FirstN_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the first set of items in the list by specifying how many items to return or a qualifying condition.

List.FirstN_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message:
• If a number is specified, up to that many items are returned.
  • If a condition is specified, all items are returned that initially meet the condition. Once an item fails the condition, no further items are considered.

List.FirstN_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Find the intial values in the list {3, 4, 5, -1, 7, 8, 2} that are greater than 0.

List.MatchesAll_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns true if the condition function is satisfied by all values in the list.

List.MatchesAll_Documentation.LongDescri.message: Returns true if the condition function, condition, is satisfied by all values in the list list, otherwise returns false.

List.MatchesAll_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Determine if all the values in the list {11, 12, 13} are greater than 10.

List.MatchesAll_Documentation.Examples_1.message: Determine if all the values in the list {1, 2, 3} are greater than 10.

List.MatchesAny_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns true if the condition function is satisfied by any value.

List.MatchesAny_Documentation.LongDescri.message: Returns true if the condition function, condition, is satisfied by any of values in the list list, otherwise returns false.

List.MatchesAny_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Find if any of the values in the list {9, 10, 11} are greater than 10.

List.MatchesAny_Documentation.Examples_1.message: Find if any of the values in the list {1, 2, 3} are greater than 10.

List.MaxN_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the maximum value(s) in the list. The number of values to return or a filtering condition must be specified.

List.MaxN_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Returns the maximum value(s) in the list, list. After the rows are sorted, optional parameters may be specified to further filter the result. The optional parameter countOrCondition specifies the number of values to return or a filtering condition. The optional parameter comparisonCriteria specifies how to compare values in the list.
  • list: The list of values.
  • countOrCondition: If a number is specified, a list of up to countOrCondition items in ascending order is returned. If a condition is specified, a list of items that initially meet the condition is returned. Once an item fails the condition, no further items are considered.
  • comparisonCriteria: [Optional] An optional comparisonCriteria value can be specified to determine how to compare the items in the list. If this parameter is null, the default comparer is used.

List.MinN_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the minimum value(s) in the list. The number of values to return or a filtering condition may be specified.

List.MinN_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Returns the minimum value(s) in the list, list. The parameter, countOrCondition, specifies the number of values to return or a filtering condition. The optional parameter, comparisonCriteria, specifies how to compare values in the list.
  • list: The list of values.
  • countOrCondition: If a number is specified, a list of up to countOrCondition items in ascending order is returned. If a condition is specified, a list of items that initially meet the condition is returned. Once an item fails the condition, no further items are considered. If this parameter is null, the single smallest value in the list is returned.
  • comparisonCriteria: [Optional] An optional comparisonCriteria value can be specified to determine how to compare the items in the list. If this parameter is null, the default comparer is used.

List.MinN_Documentation.Examples_0_Descr.message: Find the 5 smallest values in the list {3, 4, 5, -1, 7, 8, 2}.

List.Numbers_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list of numbers given an initial value, count, and optional increment value.

List.Numbers_Documentation.LongDescripti.message:
Returns a list of numbers given an initial value, count, and optional increment value. The default increment value is 1.
  • start: The initial value in the list.
  • count: The number of values to create.
  • increment: [Optional] The value to increment by. If omitted values are incremented by 1.

List.Numbers_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Generate a list of 10 consecutive numbers starting at 1.

List.Numbers_Documentation.Examples_1_De.message: Generate a list of 10 numbers starting at 1, with an increment of 2 for each subsequent number.

List.Percentile_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns one or more sample percentiles corresponding to the given probabilities.

List.Percentile_Documentation.LongDescri.message: Returns one or more sample percentiles of the list list. If the value percentiles is a number between 0.0 and 1.0, it will be treated as a percentile and the result will be a single value corresponding to that probability. If the value percentiles is a list of numbers with values between 0.0 and 1.0, the result will be a list of percentiles corresponding to the input probability. The PercentileMode option in options can be used by advanced users to pick a more-specific interpolation method but is not recommended for most uses. Predefined symbols PercentileMode.ExcelInc and PercentileMode.ExcelExc match the interpolation methods used by the Excel functions PERCENTILE.INC and PERCENTILE.EXC. The default behavior matches PercentileMode.ExcelInc. The symbols PercentileMode.SqlCont and PercentileMode.SqlDisc match the SQL Server behavior for PERCENTILE_CONT and PERCENTILE_DISC, respectively.

List.Percentile_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Find the first quartile of the list {5, 3, 1, 7, 9}.

List.Percentile_Documentation.Examples_1.message: Find the quartiles of the list {5, 3, 1, 7, 9} using an interpolation method matching Excel's PERCENTILE.EXC.

List.PositionOf_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns the offset(s) of a value in a list.

List.PositionOf_Documentation.LongDescri.message:
Returns the offset at which the value value appears in the list list. Returns -1 if the value doesn't appear. An optional occurrence parameter occurrence can be specified.
  • occurrence: The maximum number of occurrences to report.

List.PositionOf_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Find the position in the list {1, 2, 3} at which the value 3 appears.

List.PositionOfAny_Documentation.Descrip.message: Returns the first offset of a value in a list.

List.PositionOfAny_Documentation.LongDes.message:
Returns the offset in list list of the first occurrence of a value in a list values. Returns -1 if no occurrence is found. An optional occurrence parameter occurrence can be specified.
  • occurrence: The maximum number of occurrences that can be returned.

List.PositionOfAny_Documentation.Example.message: Find the first position in the list {1, 2, 3} at which the value 2 or 3 appears.

List.Range_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a subset of the list beginning at an offset.

List.Range_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns a subset of the list beginning at the offset list. An optional parameter, offset, sets the maximum number of items in the subset.

List.Range_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Find the subset starting at offset 6 of the list of numbers 1 through 10.

List.Range_Documentation.Examples_1_Desc.message: Find the subset of length 2 from offset 6, from the list of numbers 1 through 10.

List.RemoveItems_Documentation.Descripti.message: Removes items from list1 that are present in list.

List.RemoveItems_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Removes all occurrences of the given values in the list2 from list1. If the values in list2 don't exist in list1, the original list is returned.

List.RemoveItems_Documentation.Examples_.message: Remove the items in the list {2, 4, 6} from the list {1, 2, 3, 4, 2, 5, 5}.

List.RemoveMatchingItems_Documentation.D.message: Removes all occurrences of the input values.

List.RemoveMatchingItems_Documentation.L.message: Removes all occurrences of the given values in list2 from the list list1. If the values in list2 don't exist in list1, the original list is returned. An optional equation criteria value, equationCriteria, can be specified to control equality testing.

List.RemoveRange_Documentation.Descripti.message: Removes count number of values starting at the specified position.

List.RemoveRange_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Removes count values in the list starting at the specified position, index.

List.RemoveRange_Documentation.Examples_.message: Remove 3 values in the list {1, 2, 3, 4, -6, -2, -1, 5} starting at index 4.

List.Repeat_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list that is count repetitions of the original list.

List.Repeat_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Returns a list that is count repetitions of the original list, list.

List.Repeat_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Create a list that has {1, 2} repeated 3 times.

List.ReplaceMatchingItems_Documentation..message: Applies each replacement of { old, new }.

Performs the given replacements to the list list. A replacement operation replacements consists of a list of two values, the old value and new value, provided in a list. An optional equation criteria value, equationCriteria, can be specified to control equality testing.
Create a list from {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} replacing the value 5 with -5, and the value 1 with -1.

List.Select_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list of values that match the condition.

List.Select_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Returns a list of values from the list list, that match the selection condition selection.

List.Select_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Find the values in the list {1, -3, 4, 9, -2} that are greater than 0.

List.Split_Documentation.Description.message: Splits the specified list into a list of lists using the specified page size.

List.Split_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Splits list into a list of lists where the first element of the output list is a list containing the first pageSize elements from the source list, the next element of the output list is a list containing the next pageSize elements from the source list, and so on.

List.Transform_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a new list of values computed from this list.

List.Transform_Documentation.LongDescrip.message: Returns a new list of values by applying the transform function transform to the list, list.

List.Transform_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Add 1 to each value in the list {1, 2}.

Marketo.Leads_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a table with lead details.

Marketo.Leads_Documentation.LongDescript.message: Makes a call to the Marketo REST API endpoint at url/rest/v1/leads.json. All leads in list leadIds are returned.

Marketo.Leads_Documentation.Examples_0_D.message: Pulls the details for three leads

Marketo.Leads_Documentation.Examples_0_R.message: A table with details for the supplied leads

Marketo.Tables_Documentation.Description.message: Enter the URL of the Marketo REST API endpoint associated with your account.

Marketo.Tables_Documentation.LongDescrip.message: Returns a table with relevant Marketo data.

MySQL.Database_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a table of SQL tables, views, and stored scalar functions available in a MySQL database.

MySQL.Database_Documentation.LongDescrip.message:
Returns a table of SQL tables, views, and stored scalar functions available in a MySQL database on server server in the database instance named database. The port may be optionally specified with the server, separated by a colon. An optional record parameter, options, may be specified to control the following options:
  • Encoding : A TextEncoding value that specifies the character set used to encode all queries sent to the server (default is null).
  • CreateNavigationProperties : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to generate navigation properties on the returned values (default is true).
  • NavigationPropertyNameGenerator : A function that is used for the creation of names for navigation properties.
  • Query : A native SQL query used to retrieve data. If the query produces multiple result sets, only the first will be returned.
  • CommandTimeout : A duration that controls how long the server-side query is allowed to run before it is canceled. The default value is ten minutes.
  • ConnectionTimeout : A duration that controls how long to wait before abandoning an attempt to make a connection to the server. The default value is driver-dependent.
  • TreatTinyAsBoolean : A logical (true/false) that determines whether to force tinyint columns on the server as logical values. The default value is true.
  • OldGuids : A logical (true/false) that sets whether char(36) columns (if false) or binary(16) columns (if true) will be treated as GUIDs. The default value is false.
  • ReturnSingleDatabase : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to return all tables of all databases (if false) or to return tables and views of the specified database (if true). The default value is false.
  • HierarchicalNavigation : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to view the tables grouped by their schema names (default is false).
The record parameter is specified as [option1 = value1, option2 = value2...] or [Query = "select ..."] for example.

Netezza.Database_Documentation.Descripti.message: Import data from an IBM Netezza database.

Netezza.Database_Documentation.LongDescr.message:
Returns a table of Netezza tables, views, and stored functions from the Netezza Server database database on server server. The port may be optionally specified with the server, separated by a colon. An optional record parameter, options, may be specified to control the following options:
  • CreateNavigationProperties: A logical (true/false) that sets whether to generate navigation properties on the returned values (default is true)
  • HierarchicalNavigation: A logical (true/false) that sets whether to view the tables grouped by their schema names (default is false)
  • ConnectionTimeout: A duration which controls how long to wait before abandoning an attempt to make a connection to the server. The default value is driver-dependent.
  • CommandTimeout: A duration which controls how long the server-side query is allowed to run before it is canceled. The default value is driver-dependent.
  • NormalizeDatabaseName: A logical (true/false) that sets whether to normalize database name to upper case or interpret it literally (default is true).
The record parameter is specified as [option1 = value1, option2 = value2...].

Netezza.Database_Documentation.Examples_.message: List the tables in an IBM Netezza project.

Number.Atan2_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the arctangent of the division of the two numbers.

Number.Atan2_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns the arctangent of the division of the two numbers, y and x. The divison will be constructed as y/x.

Number.BitwiseAnd_Documentation.Descript.message: Returns the result of performing a bitwise "And" operation between the two inputs.

Number.BitwiseAnd_Documentation.LongDesc.message: Returns the result of performing a bitwise "And" operation between number1 and number2.

Number.BitwiseOr_Documentation.Descripti.message: Returns the result of performing a bitwise "Or" between the two inputs.

Number.BitwiseOr_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Returns the result of performing a bitwise "Or" between number1 and number2.

Number.BitwiseShiftLeft_Documentation.De.message: Shifts the bits set to the left.

Number.BitwiseShiftLeft_Documentation.Lo.message: Returns the result of performing a bitwise shift to the left on number1, by the specified number of bits number2.

Number.BitwiseShiftRight_Documentation.D.message: Shifts the bits set to the right.

Number.BitwiseShiftRight_Documentation.L.message: Returns the result of performing a bitwise shift to the right on number1, by the specified number of bits number2.

Number.BitwiseXor_Documentation.Descript.message: Returns the result of performing a bitwise "XOR" (Exclusive-OR) between the two inputs.

Number.BitwiseXor_Documentation.LongDesc.message: Returns the result of performing a bitwise "XOR" (Exclusive-OR) between number1 and number2.

Number.Combinations_Documentation.Descri.message: Returns the number of unique combinations.

Number.Combinations_Documentation.LongDe.message:
Returns the number of unique combinations from a list of items, setSize with specified combination size, combinationSize.
  • setSize: The number of items in the list.
  • combinationSize: The number of items in each combination.

Number.Combinations_Documentation.Exampl.message: Find the number of combinations from a total of 5 items when each combination is a group of 3.

Number.IntegerDivide_Documentation.Descr.message: Divides two numbers and returns the integer portion of the result.

Number.IntegerDivide_Documentation.LongD.message:
Returns the integer portion of the result from dividing a number, number1, by another number, number2. If number1 or number2 are null, Number.IntegerDivide returns null.
  • number1: The dividend.
  • number2: The divisor.

Number.Mod_Documentation.Description.message: Integer divides two numbers and returns the remainder.

Number.Mod_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Returns the remainder resulting from the integer division of number by divisor. If number or divisor are null, Number.Mod returns null.
  • number: The dividend.
  • divisor: The divisor.

Number.Mod_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Find the remainder when you divide 5 by 3.

Number.Permutations_Documentation.LongDe.message: Returns the number of permutations that can be generated from a number of items, setSize, with a specified permutation size, permutationSize.

Number.Permutations_Documentation.Exampl.message: Find the number of permutations from a total of 5 items in groups of 3.

Number.Power_Documentation.Description.message: Raises a number to the given power.

Number.Power_Documentation.LongDescripti.message:
Returns the result of raising number to the power of power. If number or power are null, Number.Power returns null.
  • number: The base.
  • power: The exponent.

Number.Power_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Find the value of 5 raised to the power of 3 (5 cubed).

Number.RandomBetween_Documentation.Descr.message: Returns a random number between two numbers.

Number.RandomBetween_Documentation.LongD.message: Returns a random number between bottom and top.

Number.RandomBetween_Documentation.Examp.message: Get a random number between 1 and 5.

Odbc.Query_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the result of running a native query on an ODBC data source.

Odbc.Query_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Returns the result of running query with the connection string connectionString using ODBC. connectionString can be text or a record of property value pairs. Property values can either be text or number. An optional record parameter, options, may be provided to specify additional properties. The record can contain the following fields:
  • ConnectionTimeout : A duration that controls how long to wait before abandoning an attempt to make a connection to the server. The default value is 15 seconds.
  • CommandTimeout : A duration that controls how long the server-side query is allowed to run before it is canceled. The default value is ten minutes.
  • SqlCompatibleWindowsAuth : A logical (true/false) that determines whether to produce SQL Server-compatible connection string options for Windows authentication. The default value is true.

Odbc.Query_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Return the result of running a simple query against the provided connection string.

OleDb.Query_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the result of running a native query on an OLE DB data source.

OleDb.Query_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message:
Returns the result of running query with the connection string connectionString using OLE DB. connectionString can be text or a record of property value pairs. Property values can either be text or number. An optional record parameter, options, may be provided to specify additional properties. The record can contain the following fields:
  • ConnectionTimeout : A duration that controls how long to wait before abandoning an attempt to make a connection to the server. The default value is driver-dependent.
  • CommandTimeout : A duration that controls how long the server-side query is allowed to run before it is canceled. The default value is ten minutes.
  • SqlCompatibleWindowsAuth : A logical (true/false) that determines whether to produce SQL Server-compatible connection string options for Windows authentication. The default value is true.

PlanviewEnterprise.Feed_Documentation.De.message: Enter the URL and database name associated with your Planview Portfolios account.

PlanviewEnterprise.Feed_Documentation.Lo.message: Returns a table with Planview Portfolios data.

PlanviewEnterprise.Feed_Documentation.Ex.message: Returns a table of Planview Portfolios information
A table of Planview Portfolios data about database pve

PostgreSQL.Database_Documentation.Descri.message: Returns a table of SQL tables and views available in a PostgreSQL database.

PostgreSQL.Database_Documentation.LongDe.message:
Returns a table of SQL tables and views available in a PostgreSQL database on server server in the database instance named database. The port may be optionally specified with the server, separated by a colon. An optional record parameter, options, may be specified to control the following options:
  • CreateNavigationProperties : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to generate navigation properties on the returned values (default is true).
  • NavigationPropertyNameGenerator : A function that is used for the creation of names for navigation properties.
  • Query : A native SQL query used to retrieve data. If the query produces multiple result sets, only the first will be returned.
  • CommandTimeout : A duration that controls how long the server-side query is allowed to run before it is canceled. The default value is ten minutes.
  • ConnectionTimeout : A duration that controls how long to wait before abandoning an attempt to make a connection to the server. The default value is driver-dependent.
  • HierarchicalNavigation : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to view the tables grouped by their schema names (default is false).
The record parameter is specified as [option1 = value1, option2 = value2...] or [Query = "select ..."] for example.

Record.Field_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the value of the specified field in a record.

Record.Field_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns the value of the specified field in the record. If the field is not found, an exception is thrown.

Record.Field_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Find the value of field "CustomerID" in the record.

Record.FieldOrDefault_Documentation.Desc.message: Returns the value of the specified field in a record or the default value if the field is not found.

Record.FieldOrDefault_Documentation.Long.message: Returns the value of the specified field field in the record record. If the field is not found, the optional defaultValue is returned.

Record.FieldOrDefault_Documentation.Exam.message: Find the value of field "Phone" in the record, or return null if it doesn't exist.
Find the value of field "Phone" in the record, or return the default if it doesn't exist.

Record.FromList_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns a record given a list of field values and a set of fields.

Record.FromList_Documentation.LongDescri.message: Returns a record given a list of field values and a set of fields. The fields can be specified either by a list of text values, or a record type. An error is thrown if the fields are not unique.

Record.FromList_Documentation.Examples_0.message: Build a record from a list of field values and a list of field names.

Record.FromList_Documentation.Examples_1.message: Build a record from a list of field values and a record type.
Record.FromList({1, "Bob", "123-4567"}, type [CustomerID = number, Name = text, Phone = number])

Record.HasFields_Documentation.Descripti.message: Indicates whether the record has the specified fields.

Record.HasFields_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Indicates whether the record record has the fields specified in fields, by returning a logical value (true or false). Multiple field values can be specified using a list.

Record.HasFields_Documentation.Examples_.message: Check if the record has the field "CustomerID".
Check if the record has the field "CustomerID" and "Address".

Record.RemoveFields_Documentation.Descri.message: Removes the specified field(s) from the input record.

Record.RemoveFields_Documentation.LongDe.message: Returns a record that removes all the fields specified in list fields from the input record. If the field specified does not exist, an exception is thrown.

Record.RemoveFields_Documentation.Exampl.message: Remove the field "Price" from the record.
Remove the fields "Price" and "Item" from the record.

Record.RenameFields_Documentation.Descri.message: Applies rename(s) from a list in the form { old, new }.

Record.RenameFields_Documentation.LongDe.message: Returns a record after renaming fields in the input record to the new field names specified in list renames. For multiple renames, a nested list can be used ({ {old1, new1}, {old2, new2} }.

Record.RenameFields_Documentation.Exampl.message: Rename the field "UnitPrice" to "Price" from the record.
Rename the fields "UnitPrice" to "Price" and "OrderNum" to "OrderID"  from the record.

Record.ReorderFields_Documentation.Descr.message: Reorders the field(s) specified into the new order.

Record.ReorderFields_Documentation.LongD.message: Returns a record after reordering the fields in record in the order of fields specified in list fieldOrder. Field values are maintained and fields not listed in fieldOrder are left in their original position.

Record.ReorderFields_Documentation.Examp.message: Reorder some of the fields in the record.

Record.SelectFields_Documentation.Descri.message: Returns a record that contains only the specified fields.

Record.SelectFields_Documentation.LongDe.message: Returns a record which includes only the fields specified in list fields from the input record.

Record.SelectFields_Documentation.Exampl.message: Select the fields "Item" and "Price" in the record.

Record.TransformFields_Documentation.Des.message: Returns a record after applying specified transformations.

Record.TransformFields_Documentation.Lon.message:
Returns a record after applying transformations specified in list transformOperations to record. One or more fields may be transformed at a given time.
In the case of a single field being transformed, transformOperations is expected to be a list with two items. The first item in transformOperations specifies a field name, and the second item in transformOperations specifies the function to be used for transformation. For example, {"Quantity", Number.FromText}
In the case of a multiple fields being transformed, transformOperations is expected to be a list of lists, where each inner list is a pair of field name and transformation operation. For example, {{"Quantity",Number.FromText},{"UnitPrice", Number.FromText}}

Snowflake.Databases_Documentation.Descri.message: Import data from a Snowflake Computing warehouse.

Snowflake.Databases_Documentation.LongDe.message:
Returns a table listing the tables in the Snowflake Computing warehouse located at server. An optional record parameter, options, may be specified to control the following options:
  • Role: A text value to use as the Role name for the connection.
  • CreateNavigationProperties: A logical (true/false) value that sets whether to generate navigation properties on the returned values (default is true).
  • ConnectionTimeout: The number of seconds to wait for network responses from Snowflake.
  • CommandTimeout: The number of seconds to wait for a query to execute.

Snowflake.Databases_Documentation.Exampl.message: List the tables in a Snowflake warehouse.

Spark.Tables_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a table listing the tables on the specified Spark cluster.

Spark.Tables_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns a table listing the tables on the Spark cluster host using protocol. Valid protocols are: SparkProtocol.Standard, SparkProtocol.Azure, SparkProtocol.HTTP

Spark.Tables_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: List the tables in an Azure Spark instance.

Splitter.SplitTextByCharacterTransition_.message: Returns a function that splits text into a list of text according to a transition from one kind of character to another. The {0} and {1} parameters can either be a list of characters, or a function that takes a character and returns true/false.

Returns a function that splits text into a list of text according to a transition from one kind of character to another. The before and after parameters can either be a list of characters, or a function that takes a character and returns true/false.
Split the input whenever an upper or lowercase letter is followed by a digit.

Sql.Database_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a table of SQL tables, views, and stored functions from the SQL Server database.

Sql.Database_Documentation.LongDescripti.message:
Returns a table of SQL tables, views, and stored functions from the SQL Server database database on server server. The port may be optionally specified with the server, separated by a colon or a comma. An optional record parameter, options, may be specified to control the following options:
  • Query : A native SQL query used to retrieve data. If the query produces multiple result sets, only the first will be returned.
  • CreateNavigationProperties : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to generate navigation properties on the returned values (default is true).
  • NavigationPropertyNameGenerator : A function that is used for the creation of names for navigation properties.
  • MaxDegreeOfParallelism : A number that sets the value of the "maxdop" query clause in the generated SQL query.
  • CommandTimeout : A duration that controls how long the server-side query is allowed to run before it is canceled. The default value is ten minutes.
  • ConnectionTimeout : A duration that controls how long to wait before abandoning an attempt to make a connection to the server. The default value is driver-dependent.
  • HierarchicalNavigation : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to view the tables grouped by their schema names (default is false).
  • MultiSubnetFailover : A logical (true/false) that sets the value of the "MultiSubnetFailover" property in the connection string (default is false).
  • UnsafeTypeConversions : A logical (true/false) that, if true, attempts to fold type conversions which could fail and cause the entire query to fail. Not recommended for general use.
  • ContextInfo : A binary value that is used to set the CONTEXT_INFO before running each command.
  • OmitSRID : A logical (true/false) that, if true, omits the SRID when producing Well-Known Text from geometry and geography types.
  • EnableCrossDatabaseFolding : A logical (true/false) value that, if true, allows query folding across databases on the same server. The default value is false.
The record parameter is specified as [option1 = value1, option2 = value2...] or [Query = "select ..."] for example.

SqlExpression.ToExpression_Documentation.message: Converts the provided SQL query to M code. This function is intended for internal use only.
Converts the provided sql query to M code, with the available identifiers defined by environment. This function is intended for internal use only.

Sybase.Database_Documentation.Descriptio.message: Returns a table of SQL tables and views available in a Sybase database.

Sybase.Database_Documentation.LongDescri.message:
Returns a table of SQL tables and views available in a Sybase database on server server in the database instance named database. The port may be optionally specified with the server, separated by a colon. An optional record parameter, options, may be specified to control the following options:
  • CreateNavigationProperties : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to generate navigation properties on the returned values (default is true).
  • NavigationPropertyNameGenerator : A function that is used for the creation of names for navigation properties.
  • Query : A native SQL query used to retrieve data. If the query produces multiple result sets, only the first will be returned.
  • CommandTimeout : A duration that controls how long the server-side query is allowed to run before it is canceled. The default value is ten minutes.
  • ConnectionTimeout : A duration that controls how long to wait before abandoning an attempt to make a connection to the server. The default value is driver-dependent.
  • HierarchicalNavigation : A logical (true/false) that sets whether to view the tables grouped by their schema names (default is false).
The record parameter is specified as [option1 = value1, option2 = value2...] or [Query = "select ..."] for example.

Table.AddIndexColumn_Documentation.Descr.message: Appends a column with explicit position values.

Table.AddIndexColumn_Documentation.LongD.message: Appends a column named newColumnName to the table with explicit position values. An optional value, initialValue, the initial index value. An optional value, increment, specifies how much to increment each index value.

Table.AddIndexColumn_Documentation.Examp.message: Add an index column named "Index" to the table.
Add an index column named "index", starting at value 10 and incrementing by 5, to the table.

Table.AddIndexColumn(
    Table.FromRecords({
        [CustomerID = 1, Name = "Bob", Phone = "123-4567"],
        [CustomerID = 2, Name = "Jim", Phone = "987-6543"],
        [CustomerID = 3, Name = "Paul", Phone = "543-7890"],
        [CustomerID = 4, Name = "Ringo", Phone = "232-1550"]
    }),
    "Index",
    10,
    5
)

Table.Column_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a specified column of data from the table as a list.

Table.Column_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns the column of data specified by column from the table table as a list.

Table.Column_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Returns the values from the [Name] column in the table.

Table.ColumnsOfType_Documentation.Descri.message: Returns a list with the names of the columns that match the specified types.

Table.ColumnsOfType_Documentation.LongDe.message: Returns a list with the names of the columns from table table that match the types specified in listOfTypes.

Table.ColumnsOfType_Documentation.Exampl.message: Return the names of columns of type Number.Type from the table.

Table.ConformToPageReader_Documentation..message: This function is intended for internal use only.
This function is intended for internal use only.

Table.Contains_Documentation.Description.message: Indicates whether the specified record appears as a row in the table.

Table.Contains_Documentation.LongDescrip.message: Indicates whether the specified record, row, appears as a row in the table. An optional parameter equationCriteria may be specified to control comparison between the rows of the table.

Table.Contains_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Determine if the table contains the row.

Table.Contains_Documentation.Examples_1_.message: Determine if the table contains the row.

Table.Contains_Documentation.Examples_2_.message: Determine if the table contains the row comparing only the column [Name].

Table.ContainsAll_Documentation.Descript.message: Indicates whether all of the specified records appear as rows in the table.

Table.ContainsAll_Documentation.LongDesc.message: Indicates whether all the specified records in the list of records rows, appear as rows in the table. An optional parameter equationCriteria may be specified to control comparison between the rows of the table.

Table.ContainsAll_Documentation.Examples.message: Determine if the table contains all the rows, comparing only the column [CustomerID].
Determine if the table contains all the rows.

Table.ContainsAny_Documentation.Descript.message: Indicates whether any of the specified records appear as rows in the table.

Table.ContainsAny_Documentation.LongDesc.message: Indicates whether any the specified records in the list of records rows, appear as rows in the table. An optional parameter equationCriteria may be specified to control comparison between the rows of the table.

Table.ContainsAny_Documentation.Examples.message: Determine if the table ({[a = 1, b = 2], [a = 3, b = 4]}) contains the rows [a = 1, b = 2] or [a = 3, b = 5].
Determine if the table ({[a = 1, b = 2], [a = 3, b = 4]}) contains the rows [a = 1, b = 3] or [a = 3, b = 5].
Determine if the table (Table.FromRecords({[a = 1, b = 2], [a = 3, b = 4]})) contains the rows [a = 1, b = 3] or [a = 3, b = 5] comparing only the column [a].

Table.ExpandListColumn_Documentation.Des.message: Given a column of lists in a table, create a copy of a row for each value in its list.

Table.ExpandListColumn_Documentation.Lon.message: Given a table, where a column is a list of values, splits the list into a row for each value. Values in the other columns are duplicated in each new row created.

Table.ExpandListColumn_Documentation.Exa.message: Split the list column [Name] in the table.

Table.FillDown_Documentation.Description.message: Propagates the value of a previous cell to the null-valued cells below in the column.

Table.FillDown_Documentation.LongDescrip.message: Returns a table from the table specified where the value of a previous cell is propagated to the null-valued cells below in the columns specified.

Table.FillDown_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Return a table with the null values in column [Place] filled with the value above them from the table.

Table.FromRecords({
    [Place = 1, Name = "Bob"],
    [Place = 1, Name = "John"],
    [Place = 2, Name = "Brad"],
    [Place = 3, Name = "Mark"],
    [Place = 3, Name = "Tom"],
    [Place = 3, Name = "Adam"]
})

Table.FillUp_Documentation.Description.message: Propagates the value of a cell to the null-valued cells above in the column.

Table.FillUp_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns a table from the table specified where the value of the next cell is propagated to the null-valued cells above in the columns specified.

Table.FillUp_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Return a table with the null values in column [Column2] filled with the value below them from the table.

Table.FilterWithDataTable_Documentation..message: This function is intended for internal use only.
This function is intended for internal use only.

Table.FindText_Documentation.Description.message: Returns all the rows that contain the given text in the table.

Table.FindText_Documentation.LongDescrip.message: Returns the rows in the table table that contain the text text. If the text is not found, an empty table is returned.

Table.FindText_Documentation.Examples_0_.message: Find the rows in the table that contain "Bob".

Table.FirstN_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the first count rows specified.

Table.FirstN_Documentation.LongDescripti.message:
Returns the first row(s) of the table table, depending on the value of countOrCondition:
  • If countOrCondition is a number, that many rows (starting at the top) will be returned.
  • If countOrCondition is a condition, the rows that meet the condition will be returned until a row does not meet the condition.

Table.FirstN_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Find the first two rows of the table.

Table.FirstN_Documentation.Examples_1_De.message: Find the first rows where [a] > 0 in the table.

Table.FromPartitions_Documentation.Descr.message: Returns a table that is the result of combining a set of partitioned tables.

Table.FromPartitions_Documentation.LongD.message: Returns a table that is the result of combining a set of partitioned tables, partitions. partitionColumn is the name of the column to add. The type of the column defaults to any, but can be specified by partitionColumnType.

Table.FromPartitions_Documentation.Examp.message: Find item type from the list {number}.

Table.FromRecords({
    [
        Foo = "Bar",
        Day = 1,
        Month = "Jan",
        Year = 1994
    ],
    [
        Foo = "Bar",
        Day = 2,
        Month = "Jan",
        Year = 1994
    ],
    [
        Foo = "Bar",
        Day = 3,
        Month = "Feb",
        Year = 1994
    ],
    [
        Foo = "Bar",
        Day = 4,
        Month = "Feb",
        Year = 1994
    ]
})

Table.HasColumns_Documentation.Descripti.message: Indicates whether the table contains the specified column(s).

Table.HasColumns_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Indicates whether the table contains the specified column(s), columns. Returns true if the table contains the column(s), false otherwise.

Table.HasColumns_Documentation.Examples_.message: Determine if the table has the column [Name].
Find if the table has the column [Name] and [PhoneNumber].

Table.LastN_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the last specified number of rows.

Table.LastN_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message:
Returns the last row(s) from the table, table, depending on the value of countOrCondition:
  • If countOrCondition is a number, that many rows will be returned starting from position (end - countOrCondition).
  • If countOrCondition is a condition, the rows that meet the condition will be returned in ascending position until a row does not meet the condition.

Table.LastN_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Find the last two rows of the table.

Table.LastN_Documentation.Examples_1_Des.message: Find the last rows where [a] > 0 in the table.

Table.MatchesAllRows_Documentation.Descr.message: Indicates whether all the rows in the table meet the given condition.

Table.MatchesAllRows_Documentation.LongD.message: Indicates whether all the rows in the table match the given condition. Returns true if all of the rows match, false otherwise.

Table.MatchesAllRows_Documentation.Examp.message: Determine whether all of the row values in column [a] are even in the table.
Find if all of the row values are [a = 1, b = 2], in the table ({[a = 1, b = 2], [a = 3, b = 4]}).

Table.MatchesAnyRows_Documentation.Descr.message: Indicates whether any the rows in the table meet the given condition.

Table.MatchesAnyRows_Documentation.LongD.message: Indicates whether any the rows in the table match the given condition. Returns true if any of the rows match, false otherwise.

Table.MatchesAnyRows_Documentation.Examp.message: Determine whether any of the row values in column [a] are even in the table ({[a = 2, b = 4], [a = 6, b = 8]}).
Determine whether any of the row values are [a = 1, b = 2], in the table ({[a = 1, b = 2], [a = 3, b = 4]}).

Table.Max_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the largest row or default value using the given criteria.

Table.Max_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the largest row in the table, given the comparisonCriteria. If the table is empty, the optional default value is returned.

Table.Max_Documentation.Examples_0_Descr.message: Find the row with the largest value in column [a] in the table ({[a = 2, b = 4], [a = 6, b = 8]}).

Table.Max_Documentation.Examples_1_Descr.message: Find the row with the largest value in column [a] in the table ({}). Return -1 if empty.

Table.Min_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the smallest row or a default value using the given criteria.

Table.Min_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns the smallest row in the table, given the comparisonCriteria. If the table is empty, the optional default value is returned.

Table.Min_Documentation.Examples_0_Descr.message: Find the row with the smallest value in column [a] in the table.

Table.Min_Documentation.Examples_1_Descr.message: Find the row with the smallest value in column [a] in the table. Return -1 if empty.

Table.OnError_Documentation.Description.message: This function is intended for internal use only.

Table.OnError_Documentation.LongDescript.message: This function is intended for internal use only.

Table.PositionOf_Documentation.Descripti.message: Returns the position or positions of the row within the table.

Table.PositionOf_Documentation.LongDescr.message:
Returns the row position of the first occurrence of the row in the table specified. Returns -1 if no occurrence is found.
  • table: The input table.
  • row: The row in the table to find the position of.
  • occurrence: [Optional] Specifies which occurrences of the row to return.
  • equationCriteria: [Optional] Controls the comparison between the table rows.

Table.PositionOf_Documentation.Examples_.message: Find the position of the first occurrence of [a = 2, b = 4] in the table ({[a = 2, b = 4], [a = 6, b = 8], [a = 2, b = 4], [a = 1, b = 4]}).
Find the position of the second occurrence of [a = 2, b = 4] in the table ({[a = 2, b = 4], [a = 6, b = 8], [a = 2, b = 4], [a = 1, b = 4]}).
Find the position of all the occurrences of [a = 2, b = 4] in the table ({[a = 2, b = 4], [a = 6, b = 8], [a = 2, b = 4], [a = 1, b = 4]}).

Table.PositionOfAny_Documentation.Descri.message: Returns the position or positions of any of the specified rows within the table.

Table.PositionOfAny_Documentation.LongDe.message:
Returns the row(s) position(s) from the table of the first occurrence of the list of rows. Returns -1 if no occurrence is found.
  • table: The input table.
  • rows: The list of rows in the table to find the positions of.
  • occurrence: [Optional] Specifies which occurrences of the row to return.
  • equationCriteria: [Optional] Controls the comparison between the table rows.

Table.PositionOfAny_Documentation.Exampl.message: Find the position of the first occurrence of [a = 2, b = 4] or [a = 6, b = 8] in the table ({[a = 2, b = 4], [a = 6, b = 8], [a = 2, b = 4], [a = 1, b = 4]}).
Find the position of all the occurrences of [a = 2, b = 4] or [a = 6, b = 8] in the table ({[a = 2, b = 4], [a = 6, b = 8], [a = 2, b = 4], [a = 1, b = 4]}.

Table.PrefixColumns_Documentation.Descri.message: Returns a table where the columns have all been prefixed with the given text.

Table.PrefixColumns_Documentation.LongDe.message: Returns a table where all the column names from the table provided are prefixed with the given text, prefix, plus a period in the form prefix.ColumnName.

Table.PrefixColumns_Documentation.Exampl.message: Prefix the columns with "MyTable" in the table.

Table.Range_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the rows beginning at the specified offset.

Table.Range_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Returns the rows from the table starting at the specified offset. An optional parameter, count, specifies how many rows to return. By default, all the rows after the offset are returned.

Table.Range_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Return all the rows starting at offset 1 in the table.

Table.Range_Documentation.Examples_1_Des.message: Return one row starting at offset 1 in the table.

Table.RemoveColumns_Documentation.LongDe.message: Removes the specified columns from the table provided. If the specified column doesn't exist, an error is raised unless the optional parameter missingField specifies an alternative behavior (for example, MissingField.UseNull or MissingField.Ignore).

Table.RemoveColumns_Documentation.Exampl.message: Try to remove a non-existent column from the table.
[Expression.Error] The column 'Address' of the table wasn't found.

Table.RemoveMatchingRows_Documentation.D.message: Removes all occurrences of the specified rows from the table.

Table.RemoveMatchingRows_Documentation.L.message: Removes all occurrences of the specified rows from the table. An optional parameter equationCriteria may be specified to control the comparison between the rows of the table.

Table.RemoveMatchingRows_Documentation.E.message: Remove any rows where [a = 1] from the table ({[a = 1, b = 2], [a = 3, b = 4], [a = 1, b = 6]}).

Table.RemoveRows_Documentation.Descripti.message: Removes the specified number of rows.

Table.RemoveRows_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Removes count of rows from the beginning of the table, starting at the offset specified. A default count of 1 is used if the count parameter isn't provided.

Table.RemoveRows_Documentation.Examples_.message: Remove the first row from the table.
Remove the row at position 1 from the table.
Remove two rows starting at position 1 from the table.

Table.RenameColumns_Documentation.Descri.message: Applies rename(s) of the form {old, new}.

Table.RenameColumns_Documentation.LongDe.message: Performs the given renames to the columns in table table. A replacement operation renames consists of a list of two values, the old column name and new column name, provided in a list. If the column doesn't exist, an exception is thrown unless the optional parameter missingField specifies an alternative (eg. MissingField.UseNull or MissingField.Ignore).

Table.RenameColumns_Documentation.Exampl.message: Replace the column name "CustomerNum" with "CustomerID" in the table.
Replace the column name "CustomerNum" with "CustomerID" and "PhoneNum" with "Phone" in the table.
Replace the column name "NewCol" with "NewColumn" in the table, and ignore if the column doesn't exist.

Table.ReorderColumns_Documentation.Descr.message: Returns a table with the columns in the specified order.

Table.ReorderColumns_Documentation.LongD.message: Returns a table from the input table, with the columns in the order specified by columnOrder. Columns that are not specified in the list will not be reordered. If the column doesn't exist, an exception is thrown unless the optional parameter missingField specifies an alternative (eg. MissingField.UseNull or MissingField.Ignore).

Table.ReorderColumns_Documentation.Examp.message: Switch the order of the columns [Phone] and [Name] in the table.
Switch the order of the columns [Phone] and [Address] or use "MissingField.Ignore" in the table. It doesn't change the table because column [Address] doesn't exist.

Table.Repeat_Documentation.Description.message: Repeats the rows of the tables a specified number of times.

Table.Repeat_Documentation.LongDescripti.message: Returns a table with the rows from the input table repeated the specified count times.

Table.Repeat_Documentation.Examples_0_De.message: Repeat the rows in the table two times.

Table.ReplaceErrorValues_Documentation.D.message: Replaces the error values in the specified columns with the corresponding specified value.

Table.ReplaceErrorValues_Documentation.L.message: Replaces the error values in the specified columns of the table with the new values in the errorReplacement list. The format of the list is {{column1, value1}, }. There may only be one replacement value per column, specifying the column more than once will result in an error.

Table.ReplaceErrorValues_Documentation.E.message: Replace the error value with the text "world" in the table.
Replace the error value in column A with the text "hello" and in column B with the text "world" in the table.

Table.ReplaceKeys_Documentation.Descript.message: Replaces the keys of the specified table.

Table.ReplaceKeys_Documentation.LongDesc.message: Replaces the keys of the specified table.

Table.ReplaceKeys_Documentation.Examples.message: Replace the existing keys of a table.

let
    table = Table.FromRecords({
        [Id = 1, Name = "Hello There"],
        [Id = 2, Name = "Good Bye"]
    }),
    tableWithKeys = Table.AddKey(table, {"Id"}, true),
    resultTable = Table.ReplaceKeys(tableWithKeys, {[Columns = {"Id"}, Primary = false]})
in
    resultTable

Table.ReplaceMatchingRows_Documentation..message: Replaces all the specified rows with the provided row(s).

Replaces all the specified rows in the table with the provided ones. The rows to replace and the replacements are specified in replacements, using {old, new} formatting. An optional equationCriteria parameter may be specified to control comparison between the rows of the table.
Replace the rows [a = 1, b = 2] and [a = 2, b = 3] with [a = -1, b = -2],[a = -2, b = -3] in the table.

Table.ReplaceRelationshipIdentity_Docume.message: This function is intended for internal use only.
This function is intended for internal use only.

Table.SelectColumns_Documentation.Descri.message: Returns a table with only the specified columns.

Table.SelectColumns_Documentation.LongDe.message:
Returns the table with only the specified columns.
  • table: The provided table.
  • columns: The list of columns from the table table to return. Columns in the returned table are in the order listed in columns.
  • missingField: (Optional) What to do if the column does not exist. Example: MissingField.UseNull or MissingField.Ignore.

Table.SelectColumns_Documentation.Exampl.message: If the included column does not exist, the default result is an error.
[Expression.Error] The field 'NewColumn' of the record wasn't found.
If the included column does not exist, option MissingField.UseNull creates a column of null values.

Table.SelectRows_Documentation.Descripti.message: Selects the rows that meet the condition function.

Table.SelectRows_Documentation.LongDescr.message: Returns a table of rows from the table, that matches the selection condition.

Table.SelectRows_Documentation.Examples_.message: Select the rows in the table where the values in [CustomerID] column are greater than 2.
Select the rows in the table where the names do not contain a "B".

Table.Sort_Documentation.Description.message: Sorts the table using one or more column names and comparison criteria.

Table.Sort_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Sorts the table using the list of one or more column names and optional comparisonCriteria in the form { { col1, comparisonCriteria }, {col2} }.

    Table.FromRecords({

        [OrderID = 5, CustomerID = 3, Item = "Bandaids", Price = 2.0],
        [OrderID = 6, CustomerID = 1, Item = "Tackle box", Price = 20.0],
        [OrderID = 7, CustomerID = 5, Item = "Bait", Price = 3.25],
        [OrderID = 8, CustomerID = 5, Item = "Fishing Rod", Price = 100.0],
        [OrderID = 9, CustomerID = 6, Item = "Bait", Price = 3.25]
    }),
    {"OrderID"}
)

Table.FromRecords({
    [OrderID = 1, CustomerID = 1, Item = "Fishing rod", Price = 100],

Table.Sort_Documentation.Examples_1_Code.message:
Table.Sort(
    Table.FromRecords({
        [OrderID = 1, CustomerID = 1, Item = "Fishing rod", Price = 100.0],
        [OrderID = 2, CustomerID = 1, Item = "1 lb. worms", Price = 5.0],
        [OrderID = 3, CustomerID = 2, Item = "Fishing net", Price = 25.0],
        [OrderID = 4, CustomerID = 3, Item = "Fish tazer", Price = 200.0],
        [OrderID = 5, CustomerID = 3, Item = "Bandaids", Price = 2.0],
        [OrderID = 6, CustomerID = 1, Item = "Tackle box", Price = 20.0],
        [OrderID = 7, CustomerID = 5, Item = "Bait", Price = 3.25],
        [OrderID = 8, CustomerID = 5, Item = "Fishing Rod", Price = 100.0],

    }),

)

Table.Sort_Documentation.Examples_1_Resu.message:
Table.FromRecords({
    [OrderID = 9, CustomerID = 6, Item = "Bait", Price = 3.25],
    [OrderID = 8, CustomerID = 5, Item = "Fishing Rod", Price = 100],
    [OrderID = 7, CustomerID = 5, Item = "Bait", Price = 3.25],
    [OrderID = 6, CustomerID = 1, Item = "Tackle box", Price = 20],
    [OrderID = 5, CustomerID = 3, Item = "Bandaids", Price = 2],
    [OrderID = 4, CustomerID = 3, Item = "Fish tazer", Price = 200],

    [OrderID = 1, CustomerID = 1, Item = "Fishing rod", Price = 100]
})

Table.Split_Documentation.Description.message: Splits the specified table into a list of tables using the specified page size.

Table.Split_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Splits table into a list of tables where the first element of the list is a table containing the first pageSize rows from the source table, the next element of the list is a table containing the next pageSize rows from the source table, and so on.

Table.Split_Documentation.Examples_0_Des.message: Split a table of five records into tables with two records each.

Table.Split_Documentation.Examples_0_Cod.message:
let

    })
in

Table.SplitAt_Documentation.Description.message: Returns a list containing the first count rows specified and the remaining rows.

Table.SplitAt_Documentation.LongDescript.message: Returns a list containing two tables: a table with the first N rows of table (as specified by count) and a table containing the remaining rows of table. If the tables of the resulting list are enumerated exactly once and in order, the function will enumerate table only once.

Table.SplitAt_Documentation.Examples_0_D.message: Return the first two rows of the table and the remaining rows of the table.

Table.TransformColumnNames_Documentation.message: Transforms column names by using the given function.

Transforms column names by using the given nameGenerator function. Valid options:
MaxLength specifies the maximum length of new column names. If the given function results with a longer column name, the long name will be trimmed.
Comparer is used to control the comparison while generating new column names. Comparers can be used to provide case-insensitive or culture and locale-aware comparisons.
The following built-in comparers are available in the formula language:
  • Comparer.Ordinal: Used to perform an exact ordinal comparison
  • Comparer.OrdinalIgnoreCase: Used to perform an exact ordinal case-insensitive comparison
  • Comparer.FromCulture: Used to perform a culture-aware comparison
Remove the #(tab) character from column names
Transform column names to generate case-insensitive names of length 6.

Table.TransformColumnNames(
    Table.FromRecords({[ColumnNum = 1, cOlumnnum = 2, coLumnNUM = 3]}),
    Text.Clean,
    [MaxLength = 6, Comparer = Comparer.OrdinalIgnoreCase]
)

Table.TransformColumnTypes_Documentation.message: Applies type transformation(s) of the form { column, type } using a specific culture.

Returns a table from the input table by applying the transform operation to the columns specified in the parameter typeTransformations (where format is { column name, type name}), using the specified culture in the optional parameter culture (for example, "en-US"). If the column doesn't exist, an exception is thrown.
Transform the number values in column [a] to text values from the table ({[a = 1, b = 2], [a = 3, b = 4]}).

Table.TransformColumns_Documentation.Des.message: Transforms the values of one or more columns.

Table.TransformColumns_Documentation.Lon.message: Transforms table by applying each column operation listed in transformOperations (where the format is { column name, transformation } or { column name, transformation, new column type }). If a defaultTransformation is specified, it will be applied to all columns not listed in transformOperations. If a column listed in transformOperations doesn't exist, an exception is thrown unless the optional parameter missingField specifies an alternative (for example, MissingField.UseNull or MissingField.Ignore).

Table.TransformColumns_Documentation.Exa.message: Convert the text values in column [A] to number values, and the number values in column [B] to text values.
Convert the number values in missing column [X] to text values, ignoring columns which don't exist.
Convert the number values in missing column [X] to text values, defaulting to null on columns which don't exist.
Increment the number values in column [B] and convert them to text values, and convert all other columns to numbers.

Table.TransformRows_Documentation.Descri.message: Transforms the rows of the table using the specified transform function.

Table.TransformRows_Documentation.LongDe.message: Creates a list by applying the transform operation to each row in table.

Table.TransformRows_Documentation.Exampl.message: Transform the rows of a table into a list of numbers.
Transform the rows of a numeric table into textual records.

Table.View_Documentation.Description.message: Creates or extends a table with user-defined handlers for query and action operations.

Table.View_Documentation.LongDescription.message:
Returns a view of table where the functions specified in handlers are used in lieu of the default behavior of an operation when the operation is applied to the view.

If table is provided, all handler functions are optional. If table isn't provided, the GetType and GetRows handler functions are required. If a handler function isn't specified for an operation, the default behavior of the operation is applied to table instead (except in the case of GetExpression).

Handler functions must return a value that is semantically equivalent to the result of applying the operation against table (or the resulting view in the case of GetExpression).

If a handler function raises an error, the default behavior of the operation is applied to the view.

Table.View can be used to implement folding to a data source the translation of M queries into source-specific queries (for example, to create T-SQL statements from M queries).

Refer to the published Power Query custom connector documentation for a more complete description of Table.View.

Table.View_Documentation.Examples_0_Desc.message: Create a basic view that doesn't require accessing the rows in order to determine the type or the row count.

Table.View_Documentation.Examples_0_Code.message:
Table.View(
    null,
    [
        GetType = () => type table [CustomerID = number, Name = text, Phone = nullable text],
        GetRows = () => Table.FromRecords({[CustomerID = 1, Name = "Bob", Phone = "123-4567"]}),
        GetRowCount = () => 1
    ]
)

Text.AfterDelimiter_Documentation.LongDe.message: Returns the portion of text after the specified delimiter. An optional numeric index indicates which occurrence of the delimiter should be considered. An optional list index indicates which occurrence of the delimiter should be considered, as well as whether indexing should be done from the start or end of the input.

Text.AfterDelimiter_Documentation.Exampl.message: Get the portion of "111-222-333" after the (first) hyphen.
Get the portion of "111-222-333" after the second hyphen.

Text.At_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the character at the specified position.

Text.BeforeDelimiter_Documentation.LongD.message: Returns the portion of text before the specified delimiter. An optional numeric index indicates which occurrence of the delimiter should be considered. An optional list index indicates which occurrence of the delimiter should be considered, as well as whether indexing should be done from the start or end of the input.

Text.BeforeDelimiter_Documentation.Examp.message: Get the portion of "111-222-333" before the (first) hyphen.

Text.Contains_Documentation.Description.message: Returns whether the text contains the substring.

Text.Contains_Documentation.LongDescript.message:
Detects whether text contains the value substring. Returns true if the value is found. This function doesn't support wildcards or regular expressions.

The optional argument comparer can be used to specify case-insensitive or culture and locale-aware comparisons. The following built-in comparers are available in the formula language:
  • Comparer.Ordinal: Used to perform a case-sensitive ordinal comparison
  • Comparer.OrdinalIgnoreCase: Used to perform a case-insensitive ordinal comparison
  • Comparer.FromCulture: Used to perform a culture-aware comparison

Text.Contains_Documentation.Examples_0_D.message: Find if the text "Hello World" contains "Hello".

Text.Contains_Documentation.Examples_1_D.message: Find if the text "Hello World" contains "hello".

Text.Contains_Documentation.Examples_2_D.message: Find if the text "Hello World" contains "hello", using a case-insensitive comparer.

Text.End_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the last characters of the text.

Text.End_Documentation.LongDescription.message: Returns a text value that is the last count characters of the text value text.

Text.End_Documentation.Examples_0_Descri.message: Get the last 5 characters of the text "Hello, World".

Text.EndsWith_Documentation.Description.message: Indicates whether the text ends in the specified value.

Text.EndsWith_Documentation.LongDescript.message:
Indicates whether the given text, text, ends with the specified value, substring. The indication is case sensitive.
comparer is a Comparer which is used to control the comparison. Comparers can be used to provide case-insensitive or culture and locale-aware comparisons.
The following built-in comparers are available in the formula language:
  • Comparer.Ordinal: Used to perform an exact ordinal comparison
  • Comparer.OrdinalIgnoreCase: Used to perform an exact ordinal case-insensitive comparison
  • Comparer.FromCulture: Used to perform a culture-aware comparison

Text.Format_Documentation.Description.message: Returns formatted text from a format string and arguments.

Text.Format_Documentation.LongDescriptio.message: Returns formatted text that is created by applying arguments from a list or record to a format string formatString. An optional culture may also be provided (for example, "en-US").

Text.Format_Documentation.Examples_1_Des.message: Format different data types from a record according to United States English culture.

Text.Format_Documentation.Examples_1_Cod.message:

    "The time for the #[distance] km run held in #[city] on #[date] was #[duration].",
    [
        city = "Seattle",

        duration = #duration(0, 0, 54, 40),

Text.Middle_Documentation.Description.message: Returns the substring up to a specific length.

Returns the position of the specified occurrence of the text value substring found in text. An optional parameter occurrence may be used to specify which occurrence position to return (first occurrence by default). Returns -1 if substring was not found.
comparer is a Comparer which is used to control the comparison. Comparers can be used to provide case-insensitive or culture and locale-aware comparisons.
The following built-in comparers are available in the formula language:
  • Comparer.Ordinal: Used to perform an exact ordinal comparison
  • Comparer.OrdinalIgnoreCase: Used to perform an exact ordinal case-insensitive comparison

Value.NativeQuery_Documentation.Descript.message: Evaluates a query against a target.

Value.NativeQuery_Documentation.LongDesc.message:
Evaluates query against target using the parameters specified in parameters and the options specified in options.

The output of the query is defined by target.

target provides the context for the operation described by query.

query describes the query to be executed against target. query is expressed in a manner specific to target (for example, a T-SQL statement).

The optional parameters value may contain either a list or record as appropriate to supply the parameter values expected by query.

The optional options record may contain options that affect the evaluation behavior of query against target. These options are specific to target.

Value.NullableEquals_Documentation.Descr.message: Returns whether two values are equal.

Value.NullableEquals_Documentation.LongD.message: Returns null if either argument 'value1', 'value2' is null, otherwise equivalent to Value.Equals.

Vertica.Database_Documentation.LongDescr.message:
Returns a table of schemas available on the server named by the server parameter in the database named by the database parameter. An optional record parameter, options, may be provided to specify additional properties. The record can contain the following fields:
  • ConnectionTimeout: A duration which controls how long to wait before abandoning an attempt to make a connection to the server. The default value is driver-dependent.
  • CommandTimeout : A duration which controls how long the server-side query is allowed to run before it is canceled. The default value is driver dependent.

WebAction.Request_Documentation.Descript.message: Creates an action that, when executed, will return the results of performing an HTTP request as a binary value.

WebAction.Request_Documentation.LongDesc.message:
Creates an action that, when executed, will return the results of performing a method request against url using HTTP as a binary value. An optional record parameter, options, may be provided to specify additional properties. The record can contain the following fields:
  • Query : Programmatically add query parameters to the URL without having to worry about escaping.
  • ApiKeyName : If the target site has a notion of an API key, this parameter can be used to specify the name (not the value) of the key parameter that must be used in the URL. The actual key value is provided in the credential.
  • Headers : Specifying this value as a record will supply additional headers to an HTTP request.
  • Timeout : Specifying this value as a duration will change the timeout for an HTTP request. The default value is 100 seconds.
  • ExcludedFromCacheKey : Specifying this value as a list will exclude these HTTP header keys from being part of the calculation for caching data.
  • IsRetry : Specifying this logical value as true will ignore any existing response in the cache when fetching data.
  • ManualStatusHandling : Specifying this value as a list will prevent any builtin handling for HTTP requests whose response has one of these status codes.
  • RelativePath : Specifying this value as text appends it to the base URL before making the request.
  • Content : Specifying this value will cause its contents to become the body of the HTTP request.

Note that this function is disabled in most contexts. Consider using Web.Contents or Web.Headers instead.

WebAction.Request_Documentation.Examples.message: Perform a GET request against Bing.
